knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

I dropped all my classes but I am still being charged for international student health insurance. Can I have those charges removed?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Please submit your request, including your full name and Gnumber, to insure@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I take summer classes before my first fall term?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If your admission is for the fall semester, you may have the option to begin taking classes in the summer prior to your admission date. If you would like to begin taking classes in the summer session, please contact the Registrar’s Office for assistance.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is INTO Mason?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The INTO Mason Program is for international students who need additional language and academic preparation before continuing on to an undergraduate or graduate degree program. Please visit https://www.gmu.edu/academics/into-mason for more information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What are the graduate international transcript evaluation guidelines?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Graduate applicants have the option to use Mason's internal transcript evaluation service versus paying a NACES agency for the course-by-course evaluation. After we receive all required transcripts, we require a minimum of 6-8 weeks to complete your transcript evaluation. We cannot guarantee the evaluation will be completed for transcripts received in our office less than 4-6 weeks ahead of the deadline due to the 6-8 review of the free Mason Evaluation option. If you would like Mason to perform the evaluation, please select this option on your online application form.

Please refer to the Office of Admissions International Transcript Guidelines for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

How do I apply to the Honors College?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Prospective Freshman
Students may apply for the Honors College when they complete their George Mason University online application or through Mason's supplement to the Common Application.

Transfer Students
Students transferring from another college or university may apply to the Honors College while applying to the university through the online application.

Current Mason Students
Requirements include having completed at least 24 credits at Mason, having a minimum 3.5 GPA at Mason, submission of one letter of recommendation, as well as the completion of an essay. The application and additional information can be found Honors College Current.

For additional information, visit https://honorscollege.gmu.edu/admissions.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is the GRE required for graduate admission?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Some of our graduate programs require the GRE. Please refer to your program of interest on our Application Deadlines and Requirements page to see if the GRE is required. If waivers of the GRE are offered, information will be listed on that page.

While there is no minimum score requirement for the GRE, faculty will review this score and consider it with other academic credentials. Our faculties review all applications holistically, meaning they review all of the individual pieces of an application, along with the strength of the current application pool, in order to make their admission decision. Due to the holistic nature of the application review, we do not wish to place restrictions on published minimum GRE scores, as this score may have varying effects on individual student applications due to the multiple factors considered.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I would like to give someone or an organization access to my graduate admissions records. How do I grant them access?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
In order to grant another individual or organization access to your student records, please contact us at masongrad@gmu.edu informing us of the request and your need for an Authorized Agent Form.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Am I eligible to apply for graduate studies at Mason?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

To be considered for graduate admission, you must meet the criteria set by the university and your desired program of interest.

Additional information related to program requirements, deadlines, and the application itself, please visit our How to Apply Graduate website.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My application status online says “Complete”. What does that mean?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If your application status says “Complete”, it means that all necessary documents have been submitted and received. Once your application is “out for decision", your application is under review by the program’s faculty reviewers. Obtaining a decision can take 6-8 weeks. Please keep in mind that decisions are made by the program you have applied to, not the Graduate Admissions Office. Hence, the decision-making timeline may vary. If you would like an updated timeline more specific to your case, we recommend you contact the Graduate Academic Unit under which you have applied.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Do you offer fee waivers for graduate admissions applications?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Application fee waivers are only offered under specific circumstances. The following waivers are listed at the end of the initial application:

• George Mason Employee Waiver
• Senior Citizen Waiver
• Post Decision Referral
• Recruitment Referral
• School of Business Accounting Internship Waiver
• McNair Scholar Waiver
• AmeriCorps City Year CY
• Graduate Administrative Waiver GA

The application system will provide the appropriate fee waiver based on the answers to the application questions. If none of these exceptions pertain to your application, or you have not been notified that you are eligible, then you do not qualify for an application fee waiver.

For additional information, visit https://www.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/fee-waivers.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What are dual degree graduate programs?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The dual degree programs offered at George Mason are designed for individuals to earn two graduate degrees simultaneously and reduce the number of required credits. When applying for admission, we require two separate applications: one for each program. An application fee is required for each program since the applications will be processed and reviewed independently of one another. Please make sure that the programs you are applying for are part of an approved dual degree program in our catalogue: https://catalog.gmu.edu/programs/.

Visit Dual Degree Program Arrangements for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How long does it take to get a decision on my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Complete applications may take 6-8 weeks to receive a decision. Please keep in mind that some programs have specific times in which decisions will be released. For these times, please visit the College’s webpage.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How much is the application fee for graduate admissions?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
For graduate degree-seeking applicants, the current application fee is $75 for all applicants. This fee can be paid online as the final step of the application process. Please note that applicants who are applying to more than one program must pay the application fee for each application to be considered for review.

The application for Accelerated Master’s is offered without fee for our outstanding Mason undergraduates. Visit https://www.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/apply-now/how-apply/graduate for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What are the application deadlines for graduate admissions?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please visit the Office of Graduate Admissions Application Deadlines and Requirements page to review specific programs in which you are interested. When you read them, please make sure to note if the deadline is for the application and ALL supplementary items, including GRE and TOEFL exam results, as many require a completed application on the deadline date.

If you have missed the application deadlines, please make sure you see if your program has Space Available Deadlines. If you have missed these dates as well, you must apply for the following term.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Would graduate applicants that completed their freshman year at one institution and then transferred to another institution to complete their bachelor's degree need to provide transcripts from both institutions?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Graduate applicants only need to submit transcripts for non-degree or transfer credits earned towards a graduate degree. We do not require submission of undergraduate transfer credits earned or credits from a study abroad program. The portion of the application that refers to this says "you are only required to submit official transcripts for unearned degrees if it is graduate level coursework". However, should we determine that this information is necessary in order to review an application, we will reach out to the student with this request.

knowledge-base.question:

I forgot my password for the application portal. What should I do?

Undergraduate Admissions, admissions@gmu.edu, (703) 993-2000

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Am I eligible for an application fee waiver?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
All applicants to George Mason University are required to pay a non-refundable application fee to be considered for admission. Certain applicants may qualify for an application fee waiver. These applicants include:
Freshman applicants who are eligible for ACT, NACAC, SAT, Free and Reduced Lunch Program (FRLP), or Fairfax College Partnership (FCPP) fee waivers. Waiver forms must be signed by the student's guidance counselor.
Freshman applicants who are high school scholars and who have earned Mason college credit through attendance at:
Mason's Washington Scholar Programs (http://wsp.gmu.edu/):
The Washington Journalism and Media Conference (WJMC - http://wjmc.gmu.edu/)
The Washington Youth Summit on the Environment (WYSE - http://wyse.gmu.edu/)
Freshman applicants who have participated in the Governor's School at Innovation Park are eligible for a fee waiver. Please note that is it only for students at the Innovation Park Governor's School, not other Governor's Schools.
Freshman applicants who are members of the Early Identification Program (EIP)
Participants of the Mason Dream Catchers program
Transfer applicants who are currently receiving a full PELL award at their current institution. Documentation showing full PELL is required to be eligible.
McNair Scholars
Graduate, Non-Degree, and Transfer applicants that are full-time Mason faculty or classified staff
Under the terms of the Senior Citizens Higher Education Act of 1974, eligible Virginia residents, 60 years or older with a taxable income of less than $23,850, may qualify for an application waiver
Please note that many fee waivers require you to submit appropriate documentation. Your eligibility for an application fee waiver is generally determined at the point of application. Please be advised that if you are uncertain if you qualify for an application fee waiver, to contact the Office of Admissions at (703) 993-2000 to seek guidance before you submit your application. Incorrectly indicating fee waiver eligibility will dramatically delay your application and require you to pay the application fee before a decision can be made.

knowledge-base.question:

Why was I denied admission to a graduate program?

Graduate studies at George Mason University are competitive and limited in size, and the entirety of an applicant’s qualifications are taken into account with each application decision. To possibly receive general information on what makes a strong candidate, we encourage you to reach out to your program of interest. Contact information can be found online at https://catalog.gmu.edu/programs/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the Bachelor's to Accelerated Master's (BAM) Program?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The BAM program is designed to reward high-performing current undergraduate students at George Mason University with an opportunity to begin graduate program coursework while completing their undergraduate degree. Please visit: BAM Program for details. We strongly suggest you meet with your undergraduate advisor for details before you begin the process of inquiring or applying.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

Can I defer my freshman admission?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

We permit freshman students to request to defer their admission to Mason for either a semester or for a year. In order to defer, you must first accept your spot in our class by paying your enrollment deposit at this link: https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/next-steps-for-admitted-students/freshmen


After you have paid your enrollment deposit, you can formally submit a deferral request at the link below. The deadline to submit the request is the first day of the semester you were admitted for. Please highlight your circumstances and reason for deferring in the deferral request.


Please note that deferrals are contingent upon your application remaining exactly the same during the deferral period. As such, students are not permitted to complete college coursework elsewhere during the deferral period. If you do so, then you would need to re-apply to Mason as a transfer student: https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/transfer.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the freshman application deadline?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Freshman applicants have two deadlines to choose from for the fall semester. The non-binding, Early Action deadline is November 1st. This is also the deadline to be considered for merit scholarships and to apply for the Honors College. The Regular Decision deadline is February 1 of the following year.

For those interested in applying for the spring semester, the deadline is October 1st.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

I was admitted to Mason as an undergraduate student and I have decided not to attend. Can I request a refund of my deposit?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Please visit https://www.gmu.edu/admissions-aids/withdrawal and submit the Withdrawal Request Form. Note that this form also serves as your request for a refund of your enrollment and/or housing deposit if submitted by these dates:

May 1: fall freshman admits
June 15: fall transfer admits
December 1: spring term admits (freshman and transfer)

After these dates, deposits are non-refundable.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Will Mason accept my degree from a U.S. unaccredited institution?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

George Mason accepts and recognizes accreditation ONLY from the following seven agencies:

• Middle States Association of Colleges and Schools, Commission on Higher Education (MSA)
• New England Commission of Higher Education, Inc. (NECHE)
• Higher Learning Commission (HLC)
• Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities (NWCCU)
• Southern Association of Colleges and Schools, Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC)
• Western Association of Schools and Colleges, Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges (WASC-ACCJC)
• Western Association of Schools and Colleges, Accrediting Commission for Colleges and Universities (WASC-ACSCU)

If you are unsure of your school’s accreditation, you can look up their accreditation information at https://www.chea.org/ or http://ope.ed.gov/accreditation/.
 

If you have additional questions or concerns, please email us at masongrad@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I defer my offer of admission to a graduate program to a different semester?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you have not submitted your intent to enroll confirmation and wish to move your offer of admission to another term, you can click on the highlighted "confirm your intent to enroll" in your decision letter and proceed with selecting the option to "Defer". You may only request to move your admission a maximum of one year from the original admission. If you have already submitted your intent to enroll confirmation, but have changed your plans and intend to move your admission, you may do so in the Enrollment Confirmation Letter. Simply view your decision letter and scroll down to the bottom. Click on the highlighted "please click here" button under "If you change your mind regarding your enrollment for this term and decide to either defer or withdraw, you must take the following steps." This will take you to another page where you can submit your changes.

Please remember to check the Office of Graduate Admissions Deadlines and Requirements page to ensure that your program accepts applicants for the term you wish to move your admission to. We will be happy to process your request if your application is eligible for deferral or reconsideration. Please keep in mind that not all programs offer automatic deferrals of admission and instead, some programs offer "reconsideration" of admission. In a reconsideration, a new application for the original program would need to be created and resent to the faculty for consideration. All deferrals and reconsideration processing is offered free of charge if you are eligible. If you are uncertain if your program offers a deferral or a reconsideration option, please email us at masongrad@gmu.edu.

Please keep in mind that the Office of Graduate Admissions is unable to drop you from your courses. If you have already registered for courses, please drop these courses in PatriotWeb as to not be assessed tuition and fees. Unfortunately, if we find that you are not eligible for a deferral or reconsideration, you will be required to reapply to the program with a new application and application fee. If you have any additional questions or concerns, please email us at masongrad@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I determine if I need to re-enroll or re-apply to Mason?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Re-Apply after never attending:

If an admitted student never attended and failed to officially defer their admission term or is otherwise ineligible to re-enroll, they must re-apply to the university.

Undergraduate Admissions Deferral: https://www.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/deferral
Graduate Admissions Deferral: Can be submitted through the application account.

Readmission after Previous Attendance (Re-Apply):

Undergraduate students who have missed one or more consecutive semesters of enrollment (excluding summer term) at Mason must apply for readmission through the Office of Admissions if any of the following conditions are true:
 
The student has not been enrolled at Mason for more than 2 years (5 semesters, not including Summer), and an approved Leave of Absence form is not on file
The student is an undergraduate returning after any absence during which he or she studied at another institution without prior written permission of his or her school or college. Such students must reapply as transfer students.
The student was suspended or dismissed from any college or university for nonacademic reasons
The student was academically dismissed from Mason
The student was ever convicted of a felony

Re-enrollment after Previous Attendance:

Students in good academic standing who have missed one or more consecutive semesters of enrollment (excluding summer term) at Mason, and who do not meet any of the excluded categories listed under Readmission after Previous Attendance may re-enter by completing a Re-enrollment Application - Undergraduate available through the Office of the University Registrar.

Undergraduate students do not need to submit a Re-enrollment Application if an approved Leave of Absence is on file. Upon re-enrollment, undergraduate students will be required to meet new catalog year requirements. Some academic programs require departmental approval prior to re-enrollment.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I apply to Mason as a freshman?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

You apply to Mason using the Common Application or the Mason exclusive application. We do not prefer one application over the other. Your application will need to include four things: a completed application, the application fee or appropriate fee waiver, an official copy of your high school transcript, and your official or self-reported SAT or ACT scores, unless you apply Score Optional. A personal statement and letters of recommendation are optional, but strongly recommended. Students must submit an additional essay if they wish to be considered for the Honors College. The application and detailed admissions requirements are available online at https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/freshman. 

The admissions committee takes a holistic approach to making decisions on applications, reviewing all components of each application thoroughly. High school curriculum and rigorous coursework, grades, grade trends, test scores (if applicable), and any supplemental information are considered. The median weighted GPA for freshmen admitted to Mason is between a 3.3-3.9. The median SAT score range for our admitted students is between 1100-1210, which is about a 23-29 composite on the ACT. These numbers, especially test scores, should never deter anyone from applying to Mason because of our holistic review process. Remember, we are Score Optional, so it is the applicant’s choice whether to submit standardized test scores as a part of our admission process.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My graduate admissions application status is 'Admissions Initial Processing' (AIPC). What does that mean?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

The status 'Admissions Initial Processing Completed' (AIPC) requirement is used for internal processing. Once you have successfully submitted your application, it must be processed by a specialist. Typically, processing will take 3-10 business days from the date the application is submitted. Once the AIPC is received, you will know your application has been processed.

If the AIPC checklist item is marked as received in your Online Application Portal checklist, this means your application has undergone initial processing and any items that appear as “not received” have either not been received or not yet been processed.

Please note that it can take a few business days for our office to review any newly received items, and therefore you may not see this item updated in your checklist right after submission. If you received a confirmation from your delivery service that it was delivered to the correct Mail Stop Number (MSN 4C8), please allow ample time for your documents to be processed. During this time, please continue to check your Application Portal. If a significant amount of time passes and you do not see this updated you may follow-up with our office by emailing us at masongrad@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Graduate Transcript Audit FAQ's:
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
AUDIT FAQs
Office of Graduate Admissions

Why do we audit? For compliance with George Mason University accreditation and admission standards, which requires official transcripts for a bachelor’s degrees and higher (if applicable) for our enrolled students.

What is required for the audit? An official transcript with the bachelor’s degree conferral date and ANY other degree earned that is a bachelor’s degree OR higher.  Conferral date must be present on all transcripts. If a student graduated from Mason, Admissions will pull those transcripts - students do not need to request Mason transcripts.

What is considered official and how may it be submitted? An official transcript sent from the undergraduate or graduate institution to Mason (electronically or through the mail) with the bachelor’s or master’s degree conferral date.  Students may opt to have an official transcript mailed to them and then bring them to the Office of Admissions (JC 213) in the original sealed envelope from the undergraduate institution.

           Electronic submissions should be sent to ugtrans@gmu.edu

           Postal Mail should be sent to:     
George Mason University
Office of Graduate Admissions
MSN-4C8- Final Transcript Submission
4400 University Drive
Fairfax, VA 22030


Multiple bachelor degrees earned?  If you have earned two bachelor's degrees, we require the official transcript for both of those degrees. If you have earned a master’s degree or doctorate, you must submit official transcripts for those as well.

Transcripts for non-bachelor’s degrees:
For the audit, do I need to submit official transcripts for schools where no degree was earned? NO
For the audit, do I need to submit official transcripts for my Associates degree? NO
For the audit, do I need to submit official transcripts for my Master’s degree? YES
For the audit, do I need to submit official transcripts for my PhD? YES

Will we return official transcripts? No. Per university policy, items submitted become university property and will not be returned.

Where can I look to see what transcripts have been submitted?  You can log into the Online Application Portal to see if you have fulfilled the EXIT requirement.  If you have, then you have exited the audit and we have received the necessary documents.  If not, then you have not exited the audit.

International Official Transcripts:
Official documents are issued by the degree granting institution and bear the official seals and signatures of the Registrar, Controller of Examinations or other institutional authority. Official documents may be printed on original security paper or be stamped, signed or attested photocopies. Mason understands that, in some rare cases, universities issue only one set of originals, so copies are permitted as long as the attestations are original.
International UNOFFICIAL transcripts (Not acceptable):
Unattested photocopies, re-copied documents, scanned documents or documents attested or verified by local notaries.
English translations prepared by a non-recognized translator, or self-translated documents.
Transcripts, mark sheets, degree certificates, diplomas, and English translations that are copied and have been opened by someone other than a Mason staff member.

For more details on international transcripts, you may visit: https://admissions.gmu.edu/documents/internationalTranscriptGuidelines.pdf

When will the hold be placed? For the spring 2022 term, a hold will be placed on student records on April 4, 2022.

What does a hold do? It prevents students from registering for classes for the next term or applying to graduate.

How is a hold removed? By submitting final, official transcripts to the Office of Graduate Admissions. We will manually remove your hold once those transcripts are processed; about 3-5 business after we receive them.

Will I receive notification that the hold is removed? Yes, we will send out an email within 24 hours notifying you when the hold is removed and when you have exited the audit.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is a Goals/Personal Statement? What do I write about?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A goals statement is an essay in which you specify your interests in the program to which you are applying, along with educational and work experience applicable to the program of interest. This is an opportunity to highlight your uniqueness and the strengths you would bring to the program. It should be concise and direct with great attention to grammar and clarity. Each program may have different suggestions for your goals statement. We strongly suggest your visit the school website at https://www2.gmu.edu/academics for the program to which you are applying; many have explicit instructions for goals statements. Typically, the goals statement is between 500-1000 words depending on the program in which you are applying.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When will my Selective Withdrawal request be processed?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The registrar's office will process these forms within 2-3 business days. You should remain in your class until you see the W grade on your transcript.

You will receive a notification email once your request has been processed. Please note that requests will not be processed if submitted before or after the selective withdrawal period.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I change my Expected Graduation Date for enrollment verification purposes?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students can change their Expected Graduation Date through PatriotWeb. Once logged in, go to the 'Student Services' tab, then select 'Expected Date of Graduation'.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I withdraw my graduation application or change my graduation date?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

In order to withdraw your graduation application, you will need to submit the online 'Withdraw Graduation Application' form, found at https://registrar.gmu.edu/forms/.

If you would like to change the term of your graduation application, you will need to submit the same 'Withdraw Graduation Application' form and reapply for the new term on PatriotWeb. Once your graduation application has successfully been withdrawn, you will need to wait overnight for the university system to refresh before you can apply to graduate from a new term.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I apply for graduation?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Apply to Graduate through PatriotWeb
Login to PatriotWeb
Click on Student Services
Click on Student Records
Click on Apply to Graduate
Read the Graduation Application Introduction and click Continue
Select a term and click Submit (This is the most recent registration term, not the graduation application term)
Select your Current program (If you have two programs, complete the steps for your first program, and then repeat the entire process for the second)
Choose your Graduation Date and click Continue
Choose the term in which you will have completed ALL degree requirements. Students intending to walk in the May Commencement ceremony and also complete required coursework in the Summer must select Summer."

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I submit a second/new graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
To apply to another/new program, simply login into your portal, using the same username and login you created for your first application submission, and apply for another/new program.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I’ve applied to a graduate program before; can the materials I've already turned in be used for a new graduate admission application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If it has been more than one year since you applied for graduate admission, you will need to resubmit your documentation in full to be considered for admission.

If it has been less than one year since you applied, our staff will do their best to retrieve your documentation, Please note however that we cannot guarantee that items were maintained, and therefore we strongly suggest you resubmit when possible for quickest processing.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I update an item in my graduate application after it has been sent to the department for a decision?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Unfortunately, once an application has been completed and sent to the department, the Office of Graduate Admissions is not able to update any items. If you have any additional questions or concerns, please email masongrad@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I get a letter that states how my transfer credits were applied to my degree?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please contact the verifications team in the Registrar's Office to request your letter. They can be reached at  verify@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I’m a graduate student and I've been out of school for a year (or more). Do I have to reapply?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Fortunately, Mason has developed a re-enrollment policy for graduate students who have been out of school more than two consecutive semesters (not counting summer semesters). Your academic department will determine whether you have the opportunity to “re-enroll” or if you will have to reapply to the program. We recommend contacting your academic department directly to discuss how your program would like for you to proceed.

Information on the re-enrollment process can be found in the online catalog. The Graduate Re-enrollment form is available at https://registrar.gmu.edu/forms/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Do non-degree undergraduate students have to reapply for admission each semester?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes. With the exception of students that remain active in the Senior Citizen Waiver Program (SCWP), non-degree undergraduate students must reapply for admission each semester.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What are the eligibility requirements for an Admissions Application Fee Waiver?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

All applicants to George Mason University are required to pay a NON-REFUNDABLE application fee to be considered for admission.

Certain applicants may qualify for an application fee waiver. These applicants include:
 

Freshman applicants who are eligible for ACT, NACAC, SAT, Free and Reduced Lunch Program (FRLP), or Fairfax College Partnership (FCPP) fee waivers. Waiver forms must be signed by your college counselor.
Freshman applicants who are high school scholars and who have earned Mason college credit through attendance at Mason's Washington Scholar Programs: The Washington Journalism and Media Conference (WJMC) or The Washington Youth Summit on the Environment (WYSE).
Freshman applicants who have participated in the Governor’s School at Innovation Park are eligible for a fee waiver. Please note that it is ONLY for students at the Innovation Park Governor’s School, not other Governor’s Schools.
Freshman applicants who are members of the Early Identification Program (EIP).
Participants of the Mason Dream Catchers program.
Transfer applicants who are graduates of the Pathway to the Baccalaureate Program.
Transfer applicants who are currently receiving a full PELL award at their current institution. Documentation showing full PELL is required to be eligible.
Graduate, Non-Degree, and Transfer applicants that are full-time Mason faculty or classified staff.
Under the terms of the Senior Citizens Higher Education Act of 1974, eligible Virginia residents, 60 years or older with a taxable income of less than $23,850 may qualify for an application waiver.


Please note that many fee waivers require you to submit appropriate documentation. 

Your eligibility for an application fee waiver is generally determined at the point of application. Please be advised that if you are uncertain if you qualify for an application fee waiver, please contact the Office of Admissions at 703-993-2400 to seek guidance BEFORE you submit your application. Incorrectly indicating fee waiver eligibility will dramatically delay your application, and require you to pay the application fee before a decision can be made.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I need to submit a copy of my or my parent's deed to the Office of Admissions.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Documents for Admissions domicile related purposes may be uploaded to admissions.gmu.edu/appdocument/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is Mason's institution code for test scores?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
5827

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How much is tuition?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please visit https://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/tuition-fees/ for current tuition and fee rates.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is there a deadline by which I have to accept my admissions offer for a graduate program?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The last date to confirm your intent to enroll in your application portal is approximately two weeks before classes begin. This ensures that there is sufficient time to process your decision so that you may register prior to the start of the term. However, it does take time to process your Intent to Enroll confirmation, as well as register, so we encourage all admitted students to confirm their intent to enroll as soon as possible. Please keep in mind that certain programs may have specific times by which you should submit your intent to enroll. If your program has a specific deadline in which you must respond to your admission, you will be notified by the program directly.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I submit official test scores to the Office of Graduate Admissions?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please visit the Office of Graduate Admissions Standardized Test Information page for instructions on how to submit a variety of official test scores including the GRE, GMAT, MCAT, Praxis, and English Proficiency tests. In order to determine the test or exam needed for your program of interest, please visit the Office of Graduate Admissions Application Deadlines and Requirements page.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
If I defer now, will I still be considered for assistantships for the semester to which I defer?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes, you can apply for assistantships at the start of each semester, but please remember that availability can vary from semester to semester. Unfortunately, acceptance for an assistantship in one semester does not guarantee acceptance at a later semester if you choose to defer. Please contact your department directly for information on applying for assistantships: https://www2.gmu.edu/academics.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What if my program requires less than 3 recommendations for my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If the program requires less than 3 letters of recommendation, students should determine how many stand-in recommenders they need and then do the following:

For each additional letter beyond your requirements, input the following name:
1. First Name: Mason
2. Last Name: Grad
3. Email: masongrad1@gmu.edu
4. Application Deadline: 01/01/2000

You may do this for as many stand-in recommenders you need, up to three, making sure to change the number at the end of the email each time to masongrad2@gmu.edu and masongrad3@gmu.edu, respectively. This instruction is also on the online application under the "Recommendations" section.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is a writing sample required for graduate applications?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If required by your program of interest, this requirement will show up on your Self Service Center 24-48 hours after the application is submitted. You can also review deadlines and requirements for your program of interest here: https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/graduate/application-deadlines-and-requirements.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is non-degree graduate admissions?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Non-degree admission is a form of admission where a student will never, as the name suggest, be able to earn a degree in this status. A non-degree graduate student may enroll in both undergraduate and graduate courses. As long as a graduate non-degree student takes at least one course a semester, the student will retain graduate non-degree status and will not have to reapply as a non-degree student. If a graduate non-degree student fails to enroll in one class a semester, the student must reapply to non-degree studies, and be accepted, to maintain non-degree status. Non-Degree offers applicants the opportunity to take comprehensive, graduate-level courses without formally pursuing a degree. This option allows individuals who do not currently wish to pursue a degree, but are interested in taking competitive courses, access to skilled faculty, our excellent research facilities and the opportunity to get a jump start on a potential graduate program in the future. Applicants must present an earned baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university, or international equivalent, verified from official transcripts with a minimum 3.00 GPA on a 4.00 grade scale. Unfortunately, students on an F-1 visa are not eligible to apply for non-degree enrollment.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Should I apply directly to a Ph.D. if I don’t have a Master’s?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Since the requirements vary amongst our wide variety of Ph.D. programs here at Mason, we strongly encourage you to reach out to the program you are interested in to discuss this as they are ultimately your best resource. You may locate their information by visiting http://catalog.gmu.edu and making your college/program selection.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I edit my recommenders before I submit my graduate admissions application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
At any time before you submit your application you can log in to your Online Portal and change your recommenders by clicking on "change recommender" in the checklist section. If you have any additional questions, please email the Office of Graduate Admissions at masongrad@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I make changes to my application once it has been submitted?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you believe you submitted incorrect information in your application, please let us know what corrections you would like to make so we can quickly update this information for you. If you would like to submit additional documentation such as a personal statement or recommendation letters, those can be submitted separately. You can submit these documents by sending them directly to our email account at admissions@gmu.edu. Changes or additional documents for graduate applications should be sent to masongrad@gmu.edu. Please be sure to include your full name and Mason ID Number (G Number) so that we can attach these documents to your application. You should receive via email your Mason ID Number (G Number) within a couple days of submitting your application. If you have any further questions please feel free to contact the Office of Admissions.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Do you accept electronic transcripts?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students may have their electronic transcripts sent directly from their current or previous university to Mason. Undergraduate applicants should use the email address ugtrans@gmu.edu and graduate applicants should use masongrad@gmu.edu to have their transcripts attached to their student record or application. Unfortunately, we are unable to accept an applicant/student sending e-transcripts personally to these email addresses as the transcript is no longer considered official.

We accept electronic transcripts from Parchment/Docufide, National Transcript Center/NTC, aVows, E-Scrip, Credential Solutions, National Clearing House, EDI/SPEEDE TX server, ADD’s, and Clearinghouse. Unfortunately at this time, electronic transcripts are limited to US-based universities and colleges. Students may choose to upload a scanned PDF copy of their official transcripts from their university to complete their application. George Mason University is able to make an admissions decision based on uploaded, unofficial transcripts, and if an applicant is admitted, they must submit official hard copies (or official electronic copies) of their transcripts to complete their student file.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Why am I having trouble uploading documents to the online graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The online application portal can only accept documents and multimedia files. Documents such as Word, Excel, PDF and Text have a maximum upload capacity of 15 MB. Uploading the PDF only in black and white, and/or removing graphics may reduce the size of your upload. Please do not mail or email duplicates of documents that were successfully uploaded to the online system. Please keep in mind that we can only accept PDF or Word documents to the Self Service Center. We are not able to accept zip files. Transcripts must be uploaded as a pdf file. You will be required to combine multiple pages of a document as a single pdf upload. We recommend using Firefox as a browser, as the application website is optimized to work with this software. Please ensure any “pop up blockers” are disabled.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What should I write in the personal statement?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
George Mason University gives freshmen applicants the option to submit a personal statement of approximately 400 words that highlights either their leadership achievements or their significant service contributions to their high school or community. Students who wish to apply to the Honors College and/or University Scholars must submit a personal statement. Students can submit the personal statement online when prompted during the application process. If you have already submitted your application but would still like to turn in a personal statement, you can email the personal statement to the Office of Admissions at admissions@gmu.edu in a word document with your full name and G Number. Here are some helpful hints when crafting your personal statement:

• Remember, the Admissions Committee wants to learn more about you. When preparing your personal statement, please take the opportunity to share information about yourself that cannot be found elsewhere on your application. The Committee is particularly interested in your leadership achievements or service contributions to your high school or community.

• Please write your personal statement in Microsoft Word (or any other word processing application), perform a spell check, and save the final version as a plain text file. Saving the file this way will allow you to easily copy and paste it into the online application.

• We discourage you from writing your personal statement in one sitting. Allow yourself ample time to draft and review your work before submitting your application.

• Your personal statement must be your own original work. However, it is certainly acceptable to have someone else review and edit your personal statement or make suggestions concerning improvements you might make.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What are the requirement for WJMC or WYSE Application Fee Waiver?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you have attended one of the Youth Leadership Conferences, our Mason Washington Journalism and Media Conference, or our Mason Washington Youth Summit on the Environment and also have received Mason college credit after the completion of the conference, then you are eligible for the waiver. If you do not fulfill both of these requirements, then, unfortunately, you are not eligible for this fee waiver.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Does my letter of recommendation for my graduate application have to come from a faculty member? Could a supervisor at work or a friend do this instead?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
It is preferable that your letters be written by a faculty member who can evaluate you as a student. We recommend you follow up with the specific program to which you are applying if this may be a concern for you. You can find contact information for Mason graduate programs here: https://www2.gmu.edu/academics/graduate-programs.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Should I waive my rights to my recommendations for my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
It is completely your decision whether or not you wish to waive your rights. Your recommender will be notified of your decision as part of their online submission, and your program will also be able to see this decision. Seeing that you waived your rights may reassure the faculty review committee that all provided support is candid and truthful. If you are still uncertain, you may wish to ask the advice of a trusted advisor, such as a faculty member, current graduate student, or supervisor. There are also many websites found through a simple online search that reference the pros and cons of each decision.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What does it mean to waive my rights to examine my letters of recommendation for my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you agree to waive: You will not be able to view the letters submitted on your behalf at any time, regardless of enrollment at the university.

If you do not agree to waive: If you are admitted and enroll at George Mason University, your letters will become part of your student record, and you will have the right to inspect them. Please note this option is only for enrolled students. If you do not enroll, regardless of your selection, you may not review your letters.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I upload international transcripts to my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes. To complete your application, you may upload scanned copies of your official attested transcripts for application review. Please make sure your documents are legible. They should include your full name, show your school name, and have your degree conferral date, if already earned. Your unofficial transcripts must be uploaded directly onto your application. If the documents you upload when you initially submit your application are not sufficient, you will be contacted by the Office of Graduate Admissions with instructions to upload the missing documents to your Online Application Portal.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can you make a decision on my graduate application with just a photocopy of my test scores?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
All applicants are required to submit official test scores prior to admission in order to complete your application. If you believe that you have sent your test scores and they have not yet arrived, please note that test scores typically take about two weeks to arrive and an additional 2-4 weeks to be added to your application. If you are requesting the Office of Graduate Admissions to locate your scores, please email masongrad@gmu.edu and attach any receipts and your unofficial test scores so we can use this information to locate your official scores. Please let us know if the test scores are coming under any alternative names. Unfortunately, your application cannot be completed without official scores.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My international university does not send out official transcripts/I'm only allowed one copy of official transcripts. What do I do to complete my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
We understand that circumstances arise where it may not be possible to obtain official documents. It if is not possible for you to obtain official copies of your transcripts, or your university has a verified online policy of issuing only one copy of transcripts, you may do one of the following:

• Best Option: You do not have to send official transcripts if you get the WES ICAP (http://www.wes.org/educators/icap.asp) evaluation sent directly to our office. If you do choose the WES ICAP as the credential evaluation, you will not need to send in a copy of official transcripts, as WES can attest your transcripts for you. This is only possible with the WES ICAP, and no other evaluation service.

• Second Best Option: You may have your official transcripts attested by an embassy or consulate before submitting them.

• Final Option: You may request an exception by sending an email to masongrad@gmu.edu with your request. In your email, ensure you detail why, referring the specific circumstance above, you are unable to get these documents, being sure to include your specific university name and country where this university is or was located. Any online information you can link to will be helpful. Upon receipt of your request, we will review and notify you via email if you meet our exception guidelines. If approved, we will include information on how to send these items, including information on any additional steps they may be required.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I was admitted to one graduate program but now I want to switch. Is that okay?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A student’s offer of admission is for a specific program and a specific term. Unfortunately, students who wish to change programs after admission must either:
1. reapply to the new program in a different college, or
2. complete at least one semester in the current program before being allowed to apply for a change of program to a new program within the college.

If you find that you are unable to apply for a change of major, you will have to submit a new application and application fee to be considered for a new program. Remember that if there are contingencies/provisions related to your admission, they will remain even if you change programs while enrolled.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What supplementary items are required for my graduate application to be complete?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Supplementary materials are any mandatory items you are required to submit in addition to the basic application materials and fee.

There are university-wide standard supplementary materials, such as transcripts or the TOEFL exam for internationally-educated applicants. These are the required items that all applicants must submit, regardless of program.

Then there are program-specific supplementary materials, such as the specific number of letters of recommendation, GRE scores, or portfolios. These were selected by the faculty who review these applications. In some instances, such as our teacher licensure or nursing programs, certain items may be required for program certification by outside organizations or boards.

Until you submit all of the required supplementary materials, both university-standard and program-specific, your application will not be reviewed for admission. You may determine what is required for your specific program on our Deadlines and Requirements page, https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/graduate/application-deadlines-and-requirements.

Do you want to complete your application faster?
1. Do not rely on postal mail to submit your materials. All supplementary items, including letters of recommendation, goals statements, self-evaluations, resumes, and writing samples, can be uploaded to our online application system.
2. Test scores such as the GRE, GMAT and TOEFL should be sent electronically from the testing agency through institution code 5827. Please do not use a department code when submitting test scores, as this can delay the review process. It can take up to 6 weeks for us to receive your scores, so please submit it early.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can you make a decision on my graduate application with just a photocopy of my international transcripts?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes, we can! We require you to upload scanned, unofficial copies of your transcripts to your application. Please make sure your documents are legible. They should include your full name, show your school name, and have your degree conferral date, if earned. Please review our International Transcript Guidelines to determine exactly what documents you must submit.

If admitted, all applicants are required to submit official, final transcripts prior to the last day to add/drop courses in their first semester to complete their enrollment requirements. If you are applying for an F1 or J1 Visa, you must submit your official transcripts prior the issuance of your I-20. If you have not yet graduated at the point of admission or have not received your final transcripts, you must submit what you have earned thus far.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My recommender is not receiving the recommendation link and/or is having problems submitting the recommendations for my graduate application. Can they email it?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
For security and validity purposes we strongly prefer that the recommender submits their recommendation through the online link that is provided through email. If your recommender is not receiving the recommendation link to their inbox, please have them check their spam or junk folders and resend the link through your Online Application Portal. If they are having trouble submitting the recommendation, please advise them to use Google Chrome web browser as this is usually the browser that works best with our application system. If the link is still not present or if they continue to experience issues when attempting to submit their recommendation, please have them send their letters as a PDF or Word file attachment to masongrad@gmu.edu. Please ask them to include your name and G number or the email address you used to submit your application so we can easily locate your file.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How many credits could I transfer into a Master’s/Ph.D. program from non-degree graduate studies?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The maximum transfer credit limit for a graduate program derives from the University requirement which states that 18 credits must be taken after admission to a Master’s program, and doctoral programs require that more than half of the required credits be taken after admission. For a 30-credit Master’s program, a maximum of 12 credits earned prior to admission may be transferred. Individual programs may have more restrictive policies regarding transfer credit.

For more information on your specific interest program, please consult the Academic Policies section of the catalog at https://catalog.gmu.edu/policies/academic/ then reach out to your desired academic unit for information https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/graduate/application-deadlines-and-requirements.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the transfer process for graduate programs?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Unfortunately Mason does not currently have a formal transfer process at the graduate level. Applicants interested in transferring credits must go through the traditional application process. If admitted, they may then work with the faculty of their admitted school to determine if any classes/credits will transfer into their graduate program. Please keep in mind that being admitted does not guarantee that credits from a previous university will transfer to a degree at Mason. 

In addition please note that there is a maximum number of credits that can be transferred into a graduate program. The maximum number of transfer credits derives from the University requirement which states that 18 credits must be taken after admission to a Master's program, and doctoral programs require that more than half of the required credits be taken after admission. For a 30-credit Master's program, a maximum of 12 credits earned prior to admission may be transferred. Please note that individual programs may have more restrictive policies regarding transfer credit.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I have attended a few different colleges/schools. What transcripts do I need to submit for my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you have earned a degree from an institution, you must submit those transcripts for review. We require all transcripts from your past degrees, regardless of your level of study (Ex. Bachelor’s, Master’s, etc.) at the previous institution, or the program in which you are applying at Mason.

Additionally, we suggest if you took more than twelve credits at a college or university to send those transcripts as well to ensure we are able to review all of your educational credentials, including grades. There are frequently important foundational courses, such as introductory Math, Science or English, which our faculty would like to see grades. Many of our programs require transcripts from all Universities attended even if you have earned less than 12 credits, so we may require you to submit these transcripts to complete your application. The Office of Graduate Admissions reserves the right to ask for all transcripts from all universities previously attended.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I had many undergraduate transfer credits from another school where I didn't earn my degree, or summer sessions from a school where I didn't earn my degree, or study abroad. Do I have to send those transcripts for my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If your grades, not just the credit hours, during that semester or year are reflected on your degree-granting transcripts, you do not need to submit those items. If the credit hours are reflected, but not the grades, you will need to upload the unofficial transcripts for the non-degree granting school. There are frequently important foundational courses, such as introductory Math, Science or English, whose grades our faculty would like to see on transcripts.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I submitted documents for my graduate application before I received my G number. Is this okay?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
As long as the name on your documents matches the name that you’ve supplied during your application process, there will be no delay in matching your items to your application. If the name is different on your materials than your online application, please email the Office of Graduate Admissions at masongrad@gmu.edu with your name as it appears on the online application, how it appears on your mailed documents, and your G number.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I apply for a student visa when I apply as a graduate student?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please visit our International Student Visa Information page, found here: https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/applying-mason/international for instructions.

Please note that all necessary forms may be uploaded as part of your online application. We strongly encourage you to upload those at the point of application submission to avoid delays in the processing of your I-20 if you are admitted.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I transition from a Senior+ to a Master's Student?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
In order to transition from a Senior+ Accelerated Master’s student to a Master’s student you must complete and submit the Bachelor's/Accelerated Master's Transition form at the time you file your Intent to Graduate from your Bachelor’s degree. Upon submission of your approved Transition form, the Office of Graduate Admissions will review and confirm that all requirements have been met within five or less business days. Your tuition and domicile status are not automatically carried over to your Master's program.

If you wish to apply for in-state tuition, please download and complete a new Application for In-State Tuition and submit it along with your transition form. If this application is not submitted, your graduate tuition will be assessed at the out-of-state tuition rate. You must submit the Application for In-State Tuition prior to the start of the semester when you start the Master's program so we may adjust your tuition rates.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I was asked to complete a Self-Evaluation Form for my graduate application. How do I fill out the Self-Evaluation form? What if I have never taken these classes?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Our faculty want to ensure you have the opportunity to present the most accurate depiction of your skills and the foundation you bring to the programs. Therefore, the Self-Evaluation is a comparison of the courses you took at your undergraduate institution to the foundation courses for your course of study at Mason requested by the faculty who will review your application for admission decision. You should carefully refer to your undergraduate transcripts and fill this out to the best of your ability. If you have not taken any classes, you may put N/A and our faculty will take this into consideration.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My score won't arrive till after my graduate program's application deadline. Did I still meet the deadline?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
While some graduate programs may allow for scores to arrive after the deadline, many specify that applications are only considered complete when all materials have been processed, including test scores.

Please visit our Application Deadlines and Requirements page to verify if your program considers application materials after the deadline on a space available basis: https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/graduate/application-deadlines-and-requirements.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I am applying to more than one graduate program. Do I have to submit everything, including transcripts and supplementary materials, for each application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Test scores and transcripts are shared between graduate programs. However, due to the unique nature of each program, other supplementary materials are not shared. Each program may have different supplementary material requirements, such as extended goals statements, letters of recommendation, or a portfolio, therefore, in order to complete the requirements for each application, you will need to upload items each time you apply.

The Office of Graduate Admissions matches GRE/TOEFL scores to each application, provided you have had the scores sent to Mason's institution code (5827), so you will not have to resend scores if applying to multiple programs or if you have applied in the past.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What documents should I have ready for upload before I start my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
In order to submit your graduate application at Mason, we require just the basic application form and fee. However, in order to complete your application for review by our faculty for an admissions decision, you must upload all of the supplementary materials required by your program, such as a goals statement or writing sample. Once you submit your online application, within a few minutes our system will update your Self-Service Center with your program-specific supplemental material requirements so that you can finish uploading your materials. By being prepared to finish your application in one sitting, you’ll save lots of time and can get your decision much faster.

To be prepared, first visit our Application Deadlines and Requirements section, https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/graduate/application-deadlines-and-requirements, then read over our Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ’s) at https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/graduate/frequently-asked-questions for information on uploading transcripts and more.

If your program requires letters of recommendation, we suggest you gather the emails and contact information for your recommenders before you sit down with the application as the online recommendation system is already built into the application and you must have that information to submit your application. We will not accept letters of recommendation outside of this online system except under extenuating circumstances. It is helpful for your recommenders to know of their role before receiving the recommendation request, and we encourage maintaining contact with them throughout the application process.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How should I prepare to have my recommenders submit online letters of recommendation for my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
We suggest you gather the emails and contact information for your recommenders as soon as you decide who will complete this process for you. Notify them of the program to which you are applying and let them know when you intend to submit your application so that they will be prepared to respond quickly. You should also warn them that these requests for recommendation are sent by email through the application system and can end up in spam or junk filters, and that they’ll need to monitor that folder.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I have been provisionally admitted but there's a mistake in my provisions. How can I change it?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please follow up with your academic advisor, whose name and email was listed in your Offer of Admission. For technical issues, you may also email us at masongrad@gmu.edu, we will investigate your situation and get back to you promptly.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I was provisionally admitted to a graduate program, but have already fulfilled my provision. Why am I still listed as a provisional graduate student?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please contact your academic department directly in order to remove your provision. The college contact information can be found here: https://www2.gmu.edu/academics/graduate-programs. Your advisor may be able to assist you as well.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I don't think I need to take the courses outlined for my provisional graduate admission. Who can I talk to?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Academic advisors in your program assigned these provisional courses based on the academic credentials you submitted for admission. They are to help build a sound foundation for your educational success. As a result, Graduate Admissions cannot waive these items or change them. If you have additional questions about your provisional courses, please follow up with your academic advisor, whose name and email was listed in your Offer of Admission.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I have lower than a 3.0 GPA, am I still eligible to apply for graduate study?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
While a 3.0 GPA is the minimum requirement for most graduate programs, faculty review applications holistically. The university, at its discretion, may, in evaluation the meeting of this requirement, additionally consider the difficulty of the baccalaureate degree, relevant work experience, or other evidence of ability to succeed in graduate study when making a decision. Therefore, individuals with a GPA below a 3.0 can still submit an application. However, please note that the Office of Graduate Admissions is unable to advise anyone on their chances of admission.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Should any of the materials for my graduate application be mailed to Mason?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
We strongly discourage applicants from using postal mail to send in any documents as part of the application process, including transcripts. By using our online application and online Self-Service Center (SSC) to upload your supplemental materials you will avoid significant delays in your application review.

For information on our application process, including using the SSC, visit https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/graduate.

In addition, we ask that you not send duplicate copies of previously uploaded documents because it requires us to match already received documents, which can delay your application. Only if you cannot upload the required supplemental materials to your Self-Service Center, then you should send your materials to: George Mason University 4400 University Drive MSN 4C8-Office of Graduate Admissions Fairfax, VA 22030.

The MSN is our Mail Stop Number and this is particularly important, as that is what ensures your items’ delivery to our office. Also, if mailing documents is a must, please note the deadline of your program and plan accordingly, as this will most likely delay completion of your application. If you submitted your application and/or materials to a mail stop other than the appropriate one listed, please anticipate an additional 1-2 week delay in your materials reaching our office. .

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My name/address is incorrect on my graduate application. How can I fix it?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If the application has already been submitted, please contact Graduate Admissions at masongrad@gmu.edu or (703) 993-9700 with the necessary information, including your G number so that changes can be made to your application.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My status says I've been provisionally admitted to a graduate program. What does that mean?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
When making their decision to admit you to the program, the admissions committee determined that to enter and complete the program, you must meet certain provisions. These provisions are outlined in your decision letter, found in your Online Application Portal. If you have any questions about your provisions, please reach out to your advisor listed in your decision letter.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
May I request more than three recommendations as part of my graduate application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Unfortunately, you cannot have more than three letters as part of the online application. The number of letters requested is determined by the faculty who will review your application. The online application system does not have a method to deliver any more additional letters of recommendation. If you choose to submit hard copies of letters of recommendation in sealed envelopes, they will be added to your file. However, we cannot accept more than 3 letters of recommendations whether electronic, hard copy, or combination of the two.

We strongly discourage applicants from using postal mail to send in any documents as part of the application process, including transcripts. By using our online application and online Self-Service Center (SSC) to upload your supplemental materials you will avoid significant delays in your application review. .

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Do I have to pay an enrollment deposit to enroll as a graduate student?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Most graduate programs at Mason do not require an enrollment deposit, and students admitted to those that do would receive correspondence from their department with details. If you are unsure whether a deposit is required for your program, you should reach out to the graduate unit your program falls under for clarification.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What are the English language proficiency test requirements for graduate admissions?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The university minimum scores are listed below, but please note that some programs may set higher minimum scores for English proficiency exams. 

TOEFL (IBT-Internet based test)
Required Score: 88 points with a minimum of 20 points total in each section. 
School of Business: 93 points total with a minimum of 20 points in each section. 
Schar School of Policy and Government: Please find information online here https://schar.gmu.edu/prospective-students/admissions/international-applicant-requirements. 
Volgenau School of Engineering: 80 points total with no section minimum requirement. 

In order to submit your scores, please use institution code 5827. Please do not enter a department code as this can delay your scores. For testing information please visit https://www.ets.org/toefl. 

TOEFL (PBT-Paper based test) 
Required score: 570

IELTS
Required Score: A minimum of 6.5 overall. 
School of Business: Minimum of 7 overall with at least a 7 in each section. 
Schar School of Policy and Government: Please find information online here https://schar.gmu.edu/prospective-students/admissions/international-applicant-requirements. 

For testing information please visit https://www.ielts.org. 

Pearson Academic Test of English
Required Score: A minimum score of 59 total. 

For testing information please visit https://pearsonpte.com. 

To view our English proficiency policy in its entirety, please visit https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/graduate/standardized-test-information. If you have additional questions or concerns, please email us at masongrad@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Do I have to take the TOEFL/IELTS/Pearson test? What if I am a U.S. Citizen or have lived in the U.S. for a long time?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Mason students participate in rigorous graduate coursework as part of their university educational experience. Therefore, students at Mason must have a full command of academic English at the graduate level in order to be successful throughout their studies. All new graduate students are expected to accurately comprehend written graduate-level English, clearly understand rapidly spoken English in classroom lectures and in professional settings, write with proper grammar and syntax, and be able to respond quickly in English using a vocabulary appropriate for collegiate settings.

For this reason, Mason has a high standard of English proficiency for graduate admission.

Mason strictly requires all students who have not earned bachelors, masters, or doctoral degree from a regionally accredited university in the United States, Canada (excluding province of Quebec), Commonwealth Caribbean (Antigua, Barbuda, Belize, Cayman Islands, Dominica, Guyana, Jamaica, St. Kitts and Nevis, St. Lucia, St. Vincent and Grenadines, and Trinidad and Tobago), United Kingdom, Ireland, Australia, or New Zealand to provide English proficiency scores. Regardless of citizenship or length of stay in the U.S., all international applicants not exempted from the countries above are required to take an English proficiency examination and meet minimum scores set by Mason in order to be considered for admission.

The TOEFL, Pearson Test of English, or IELTS exams can be used to meet this requirement. The university will not accept English-proficiency examination scores that are more than two years old. All scores must be sent directly to the Office of Admissions from the testing agency.

To view our English Proficiency policy in its entirety, please visit: https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/graduate/standardized-test-information

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I email documents that are missing from my graduate admissions application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Due to the high volume of material submissions we receive, we ask that applicants upload any eligible documents directly to their application or Online Application Portal. 

Goals statements, resumes, and unofficial transcripts can all be uploaded within the online application. The application status section, where you can upload your documents, becomes easily accessible once you have submitted and paid for your application. If there is an “upload” option next to a requirement, you can upload your documents there. We recommend using Firefox as a browser, as the application website is optimized to work with this software. 

If you need to make any changes to your uploads, like a goals statement or resume, after the application has been submitted, please contact the Office of Graduate Admissions at masongrad@gmu.edu and note the upload that needs to be changed. Our graduate admissions specialists will remove or revise the upload, allowing the necessary changes to be made. Please keep in mine that you will not be able to review the documents you have submitted, and depending on where your application is in processing, you may not have the option to update. If the "Update" button is not visible, please email us at masongrad@gmu.edu with your full name, G number, and a written request to update the specific item.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I edit my recommenders after I submit my graduate admission application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
At any time after you submit your application you can log in to your Online Portal and change your recommenders by clicking on "change recommender" in the checklist section. If you have additional questions, please email the Office of Graduate Admissions at masongrad@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I've deferred my graduate admission once, may I defer again?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Unfortunately, all applicants are allowed a maximum of one deferral per application. Although you may request to move your admission for any reason, we can only move your admission one time. If you have questions or concerns, please email us at masongrad@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
