knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Mason Foundation Scholarships for incoming freshmen attending fall semester require no separate scholarship application. Awards are open to admitted students who have confirmed their acceptance through a tuition deposit. Scholarship awards based on a combination of merit, need and availability. Some foundation scholarships are renewable provided students maintain eligibility by completing their requirements and may not be available for the current incoming class.
 

Notification of foundation scholarships for incoming freshmen begins mid-June and continues through August. Students, selected for the award will receive an official letter via email from the department or award committee. Recipients may view their awards on Patriot Web in the Financial Aid Awards section.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I apply for financial aid?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Undergraduate Students
For priority consideration of limited State and Institutional grant funds, undergraduate students must submit their FASFA by February 1, (March 1st for transfer students) and all required other documents by March 1st, each year.  

Undergraduate undocumented and DACA students may file the VASA instead of the FAFSA.  The priority filing deadline for the VASA application is February 1 each year. Awarding for prospective freshmen and new transfer students begins in early January.

Returning students will be awarded in June, after the annual Satisfactory Academic Progress review at the end of the spring term.

Graduate Students
Newly accepted graduate students who have a completed FAFSA on file will be notified about aid on a rolling basis as they complete their application for admissions.  Continuing graduate students will be notified of aid eligibility for the following year in early June.  

Questions about assistantships/fellowships must be directed to the individual departments who award them. Contact information for the specific departments can be found here: https://www2.gmu.edu/academics.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the Enrollment Freeze date?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The last date to drop courses each semester is referred to as the “Enrollment Freeze Date”.  For financial aid purposes, your enrollment is locked at the enrollment freeze date and adjustments to your aid are made based off your locked enrollment.  If needed, the Office of Student Financial Aid will adjust your grant and loan amounts based on your enrollment. 

For example, if at the beginning of the semester you were enrolled in 12 credits and received aid based on12 credits, but at the enrollment freeze date it is determined that you are now enrolled in 9 credits, your aid aid amounts will be revised based on 9 credits. For some students, this may result in a balance owed to the university.

Please visit Enrollment Freeze for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How will know I received a merit scholarship with my offer of admission?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
For students offered a merit award, notification is included in their admission acceptance letter or a separate letter after admittance to the University. Recipients are also able to view their merit offer in PatriotWeb and in their Financial Aid package.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Am I eligible to apply for scholarships through the Mason Scholarship Application?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The online Mason Scholarship Application   is open to all continuing undergraduates, admitted transfers, and graduate students. The application allows students to review and apply for scholarship opportunities offered through the Office of Student Financial Aid and various departments. Awards are based on your academic record as well as your answers to the questions on the application.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I use financial aid in the summer?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students may request a review of their summer financial aid eligibility by submitting a Summer Aid Request Form. The Summer Aid Request Form is available on the Financial Aid website  each year in early April. Students should submit the form after they are registered for their summer course(s). 

The summer term is a “trailer” at Mason. If you have remaining financial aid eligibility after fall and spring awards are made, you will be offered aid for summer. An email will be sent with instructions on how to log in to Patriot Web to accept/decline your summer financial aid offer.

Note: If you do not qualify for financial aid, or have exhausted your funding options for the year, you will be sent an email providing alternative methods to pay for your summer semester charges.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

How does a student subscribe or unsubscribe to text messaging from Patriot Forms, the online financial aid verification system?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A student may subscribe to Patriot Forms text messaging by entering their phone number on the create account screen. Student will be notified that they are subscribing to text notifications and that standard messaging rates may apply.

A student may also update their communication settings from within their profile, where they will be presented with an opt in for text messaging.

If a student would like to unsubscribe from text messaging they can reply "STOP" to the last text message they received.  This will remove their phone number from text messaging.  Additionally, a student can change their communication preferences from their profile settings. If the student would later like to subscribe to text messaging this may be done through the student's profile settings.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I apply for Federal Work Study (FWS)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you wish to be considered for the FWS program, you should indicate this preference when you submit your FAFSA. If you are not awarded FWS in your initial award package, you should contact the FWS Coordinator at FWS@gmu.edu, indicating your interest in the program and include your student ID number (G#).

Please visit Federal Work Study for detailed program information including eligibility requirements, types of jobs and benefits of the program.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Am I able to use financial aid for a study abroad program?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students may be eligible to use financial aid for study abroad. In order to determine financial aid eligibility for study abroad, students should meet with a Financial Aid Counselor, either in-person or virtually.  Students should bring a cost breakdown or budget sheet for their study abroad program (this can be obtained on the GEO website under programs). 

Contact a Financial Aid Counselor at finaid@gmu.edu or visit in-person at the Mason Student Services Center, Monday - Friday, 9am - 5pm, with no appointment required.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
If I do not meet the renewal requirements for my merit scholarship, is it possible to have it reinstated in the future?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students who have been sent a notification of loss of scholarship from the Scholarship Manager may appeal the loss by contacting gmusch@gmu.edu. Your letter or email should explain in detail the circumstances that affected your ability to meet the minimum standards for scholarship renewal. Documentation of those circumstances should be included to the extent possible. You will be notified by the Scholarship Manager if your appeal was granted. If you are granted reinstatement of your scholarship by the Appeals Committee (or, in the case of University Scholars, the director of the University Scholars program), please note that no additional requests for scholarship reinstatement will be granted should you fail to meet scholarship standards a second time.

All appeals for scholarship reinstatement must be received no later than one week prior to the start of your next semester (e.g. one week prior to fall for reinstatement for fall semester). Any appeals for scholarship reinstatement received later than one week prior to the semester will be reviewed only for the following semester. Please see the Financial Aid Handbook for more information regarding appeals.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I view my financial aid offer?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
To view your financial aid offer, login to Patriot Web at https://patriotweb.gmu.edu

Click ‘Financial Aid’
Click ‘Financial Aid Dashboard’
Click ‘Award Offer’

New students attending Mason for the first time will need to first activate a Patriot Pass account which allows access to Patriot Web. To do so, please navigate to the Password Management page HERE and click ‘Activate Account’. Note: You will need your Mason G number and a Claim Code which is your date of birth formatted as MMDDYY.

Once you have completed these steps and received your Mason Username (also called NetID) and you have set up your password, you will have access to Patriot Web where you can view your financial aid offer.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I apply for a private student loan/alternative educational loan?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Private loans, also known as alternative loans, can help cover your educational costs after all other federal, state, and institutional options have been exhausted. Unlike Federal Direct Loans, private loans are offered by private lenders and eligibility depends on your credit score. Private loans may also be available to students enrolled less than half-time, or in non-degree programs. The lender you choose will guide you through the application process.  Once the lender approves your application, they will send a certification request to the Office of Student Financial Aid. Once the financial aid office certifies the loan, the lender will send the school the funds within 10 days after they receive the certification request.  Please note that depending on your lender, the process can take 3 to 6 weeks from the time you apply until receipt of funds.  

A lender comparison tool is available here: https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/financial-aid/types-aid/loans/private-loans.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I complete Loan Entrance Counseling?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Loan Entrance counseling ensures you understand the terms and conditions of your loan and your rights and responsibilities. You'll learn what a loan is, how interest works, your options for repayment, and how to avoid delinquency and default.

When you're finished, a record of your completion will be sent to Mason's Financial Aid Office. Keep in mind that you cannot save and leave an incomplete session; you must complete entrance counseling in one sitting.

Loan Entrance Counseling can be completed at https://studentaid.gov/entrance-counseling/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is a Master Promissory Note (MPN)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The Master Promissory Note (MPN) for Direct Loans is a legal document in which you promise to repay your loan(s) and any accrued interest and fees to the U.S. Department of Education. It also explains the terms and conditions of your loan(s).

Additional information and the link to complete an MPN are located at https://studentaid.gov/mpn/ .

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Acceptable File Formats for uploading financial aid verification documents into Patriot Forms:  gmu.studentforms.com
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A student can upload a file in the following formats: PDF, PNG, BMP, or JPG.   If the student tries to upload a format that is not allowed they will receive this message with the acceptable file formats listed:

 


If the student is unable to upload their document in the current file format it is saved in, they can try to save the document in another format.
For example:
 
Student has document scanned and saved in computer as a Word document. Student can try to take a picture of the document using their phone, tablet or digital camera and uploading the document as an image.
Student is trying to upload an image of the document. Student can try to scan the document and upload as a PDF.
 
If the student needs to convert a Word or Excel document, they would need to open the document.
Select File (upper left on screen)
Select Save As
In the Save as Type dropdown, select PDF
Select Save

Please Note: In some instances a student uploads a video or gif file saved as acceptable format. If in document review the document scrolls automatically through the images quickly, this is an indicator that they have uploaded this type of file. The document will need to be rejected and the student must upload the file as individual images or as a PDF.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I increase my student loan(s) to cover my remaining balance?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students may request an increase in their Federal Direct loans (subsidized/unsubsidized) if they have not already used the maximum amount allowed for the award year as determined by the federal government and if they continue to meet all other aid eligibility requirements. 

Students/parents may request an increase of their PLUS or private loan as long as their credit is approved for the increase and the increase will not exceed their cost of attendance budget.

With the exception of a request to increase a private loan, which should be made directly to the student's lender, students should submit their loan increase request via the FA Contact Form.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
The Financial Aid Office has requested proof of my Citizenship status. What document can I submit to satisfy this requirement?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A list of acceptable documentation for verifying Citizenship status can be found at:
https://www.gmu.edu/financial-aid/eligibility/citizenship.

tags: FA In State And Out Of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How is domicile status determined?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Domicile status is initially determined by the Office of Admissions when a student applies to Mason. If a student fails to submit an Application for In-State rates at the time they apply to Mason, they will automatically classify as out-of-state. Prior to submitting your intent to enroll, all communications regarding domicile classification should be made to the Office of Admissions.

If you have already submitted your intent to enroll and would like to appeal your domicile classification, please refer to the Registrar's website for further instructions.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Patriot Forms account creation instructions for new and returning students.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Special note for Students New to Mason:
New students attending Mason for the first time need to activate a Patriot Pass account which allows access to important financial aid information via Patriot Web (a self-service website for students). To do so, please navigate to the Password Management page HERE. Note: You will need your Mason G number, which is listed above, and a Claim Code, which is your date of birth formatted as MMDDYY.

Once you have completed these steps and received your Mason Username (also called NetID) and you have set up your password, you will have access to Patriot Web where you can view your financial aid offer.

For All Students Selected for Verification:
To submit your verification documents to the Office of Financial Aid, all students (new and returning) will need to create a Patriot Forms Account.

Create Your Patriot Forms Account.

This is a one-time account creation. You’ll be asked for some basic information when creating your account. This information is used to validate your identity so that electronic signature can be used on future forms.

Four Easy Steps:
Go to Patriot Forms
Click ‘Create Account’ link
Enter/confirm your student information
Click ‘Create Account’ button
It’s important that you use the full name and correct social security number that you entered on your FAFSA so that your verification account can link up with your FAFSA. Don’t use any nicknames or shortened versions of your name. Use what you entered on your FAFSA!

Once your account is created, any required tasks you need to complete will become available.
In Patriot Forms, you will be able to:
Complete financial aid forms on your phone, tablet, or computer.
Securely upload documents from any device.
E-sign documents—both you and your parents!
Manage your financial aid tasks online.
Receive automated reminders about outstanding tasks and next steps.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

If a parent has multiple students they need to sign documents for in Patriot Forms, do they need a separate account?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Prior to July 3rd, 2020, when the parent had multiple students attending the same institution and needed to e-sign documents for the students, the parent was required to create separate accounts for each student for whom they need to provide an e-signature for on a document. Now, if a parent is creating an account and has multiple students attending the same institution, the parent can link to each student's account.
 

Any parent who created their account prior to July 3rd, 2020, will still have multiple accounts for each student at the same institution.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I return my refund to the lender?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

In the 14 days after your loan disburses to your student account, you may request that your refund be returned to your lender.
 

If returning your original, uncashed refund check, bring the check and a signed letter requesting “Return to Lender”, to the Mason Cashier’s Office drop-box in SUB1, first floor. Make sure your Gnumber is listed on your letter. Notify the financial aid office that you have initiated this return via their web contact form: https://www2.gmu.edu/financial-aid/contact-financial-aid

If your refund check has already been cashed, you will need to make a payment online in the Bill+Payment system. After making a payment for the amount you wish to return to your lender, Notify the financial aid office that you have initiated this return via their web contact form: https://www2.gmu.edu/financial-aid/contact-financial-aid


If you wish to return funds to your lender and 14 or more days have passed since your loan was disbursed to your student account, you will need to locate your loan servicer via studentaid.gov and make payment arrangements directly with the lender.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Why did my financial aid award change this year?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Eligibility for financial aid is based on federal estimates of your family’s ability to contribute to your cost of education. This is determined by the information you provide on your FAFSA.  If information on the FAFSA changes from year to year, your award may also change.  State grants and some institutional funds are limited and you must meet the priority filing deadline each year to be considered for those funds.  Additional reasons why your award may change from year to year include:
 

The cost of education may change

Your family’s income may change

Your student loan eligibility may change as you continue through school

The number of children in college or your household size reported on your FAFSA may change

You forget to reapply for financial aid and miss the FAFSA priority filing date

The amount of available funding changes

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Why is my federal loan amount less than I accepted?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Most federal student loans have loan fees that are a percentage of the total loan amount. The loan fee is deducted proportionately from each loan disbursement you receive while enrolled in school. This means the money you receive will be less than the amount you actually borrow. You’re responsible for repaying the entire amount you borrowed and not just the amount you received. Visit studentaid.gov for current loan fee percentages.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is there a limit to the amount of Pell Grant awards I can receive?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The amount of Federal Pell Grant funds you may receive over your lifetime is limited by federal law to be the equivalent of six years of Pell Grant funding. Since the amount of a scheduled Pell Grant award you can receive each award year is equal to 100%, the six-year equivalent is 600%.

If your LEU equals or exceeds 600%, you may no longer receive Pell Grant funding. Similarly, if your LEU is greater than 500% but less than 600%, while you will be eligible for a Pell Grant for the next award year, you will not be able to receive a full scheduled award.

For additional information and to view your LEU percentage, visit Student Aid Pell LEU.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I have questions about the Mason Korea Scholarship I was awarded.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Questions related to the payment or disbursement of an awarded MK Scholarship should be directed to MKFinan@gmu.edu.

Scholarship availability and eligibility requirements can be found at https://masonkorea.gmu.edu/current-students/scholarships.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My family income has changed. Can I request a re-evaluation of my financial aid package?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The Financial Aid Office may consider appeals based on a reduction of income if the student or parent experienced a significant change of income due to mitigating circumstances.

Examples of mitigating circumstances that the Financial Aid Office will consider in reduction of income appeals include:
No longer working/reduced work hours due to medical reasons or disability
Student voluntarily leaves job or reduces work hours in order to return to school
Layoff, contract not renewed, employment terminated, etc.

Examples of circumstances that the Financial Aid Office does NOT consider to be mitigating and therefore will not be considered in reduction of income appeals:
Voluntary retirement
Student or parent debt, including but not limited to mortgage, credit cards, taxes owed or car payments

To appeal financial aid eligibility based on a reduction of income, students must submit a ‘Reduction of Income Appeal’ form, along with all required documents to the Financial Aid Office. Students may request the ‘Reduction of Income Appeal’ form by submitting an inquiry at https://www2.gmu.edu/financial-aid/contact-financial-aid.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Who is my federal student loan servicer?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
To identify your federal loan servicer, please visit: https://studentaid.gov/manage-loans/repayment/servicers.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where do I go to make payments toward my federal student loan?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
To identify your federal loan servicer and make a payment, please visit https://studentaid.gov/manage-loans/make-payment.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How does my parent apply for a Direct Parent Plus loan?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Step 1: The Parent borrower should visit https://studentaid.gov/ and select the "Parent" tab on the homepage.

Step 2: Select "Apply for Parent PLUS loan".

Step 3: The Parent borrower will select "Log In To Start" with their own information and FSA ID. 

Step 4: Complete and submit the PLUS application. 

Step 5: Complete a Master Promissory Note (MPN) for the Direct Plus loan from the link within the "Parent" tab.  

Note:
PLUS loan applications for the new/upcoming school year (fall) will be available each year after July 1. 
PLUS loans require a FAFSA for the appropriate academic year
PLUS loans require a minimum of half-time enrollment (6+ credits for undergraduate students)
PLUS loans require Satisfactory Academic Progress

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can my scholarship be used to cover study abroad courses?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes, some merit scholarships can be used to study abroad. To determine eligibility, please follow the Center for Global Education guidelines and contact your Financial Aid Counselor at finaid@gmu.edu. Students must have a cost breakdown or budget sheet for their study abroad program.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I receive multiple merit scholarships?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Some awards can combine with other scholarships and financial aid. Merit awards may be cancelled or adjusted if the additional aid, scholarship, benefit or resource pays partial or full tuition.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I prove Virginia residency?
knowledge-base.answer:

To be considered for in-state tuition, students must meet the residency requirements set forth by the Code of Virginia. For questions on how domicile is determined for Virginia resident please https://registrar.gmu.edu/students/domicile/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When is the Mason Scholarship Application open for continuing students to apply?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students are encouraged to visit gmu.academicworks.com for the most up-to-date scholarship deadlines. The Mason General Scholarship Application will open in February for scholarship consideration for the following academic year. For example, the Mason General Scholarship Application for the 2020-2021 academic year opened in February 2020. Students can find additional information about Mason scholarships by visiting the Office of Student Financial Aid's Scholarships webpage.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I purchase honor cords?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Undergraduate students who qualify will be sent an email from the Office of the University Registrar informing them of their eligibility to purchase honor cords. Notification is sent approximately ten days prior to the event. Graduated students should check their unofficial transcript through PatriotWeb to verify that they received honors.

Purchasing Honor Cords
Honor cords will be available for purchase in-person at the University Bookstore at an approximate cost of $20.00. All honors students will wear the same cord regardless of their honors level. 

Honors cords are not available to purchase online and the bookstore cannot take credit card information over the phone. You must have a photo ID to purchase your honor cords.

Eligibility for University Honors and Honor Cords can be found here.

Please contact the Office of the University Registrar at 703-993-2000 or email degree@gmu.edu with any questions regarding eligibility to wear honor cords.

knowledge-base.question:

What shuttle or bus options are available for commuting to and from campus?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Shuttle services for each campus including routes, schedules, and a shuttle tracker can be found at http://shuttle.gmu.edu/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I get my Mason ID Card?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Options for requesting your Mason ID Card can be found at https://masonid.gmu.edu/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Are Mason Students required to submit proof of their COVID-19 Vaccination status?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
All George Mason University students are strongly encouraged to get vaccinated and to submit COVID-19 primary series vaccination documentation and COVID-19 booster documentation in their Patient Portal.

Student COVID-19 Vaccine and Booster information can be found at: https://shs.gmu.edu/immunizations/covidvaccinerequirement/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I need a Coalition Application Transfer Report completed. Where can I send this?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Directions to request completion of this form or any other form related to student standing or disciplinary records can be found at https://studentconduct.gmu.edu/contact-us/disciplinary-records-requests/.

knowledge-base.question:

I am applying for the Army Health Professions Scholarship Program. The application requires a "Dean's Letter" stating that I am in good standing. Where do I get this letter?
knowledge-base.answer:

Directions to request a release of student disciplinary history or a Letter of Standing can be found here.

knowledge-base.question:

Where can I find my Academic Advisor?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Find your assigned Advisor by visiting https://advising.gmu.edu/advisor-locator/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Do students need to bring a personal computer to Mason?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Mason's campus is almost completely wireless. In the residence halls, we offer wireless connections in common lounge areas and individual rooms. Ethernet ports are also offered within each individual room. The majority of our students bring their own computers from home. For students who do not have their own computers, Mason has various computer labs for student use. For locations, hours and up-to-date information, visit https://its.gmu.edu/service/computer-labs/.

If you're in the market for a new computer, feel free to consult Patriot Tech, our technology store for students, faculty, and staff: https://gmu.bncollege.com. There are always great discounts for Mason students if you purchase through Patriot Tech.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the Mason Student Services Center and what type of services are offered?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The Mason Student Services Center is the first stop and the central resource for information and solutions related to registration, financial aid, billing and payments, academic records, and other student support services. A team of cross-trained Mason Student Services Center Representatives provide assistance to new and continuing students at all points of their academic career, in one convenient location, thus eliminating the need to visit multiple offices on campus.

The Mason Student Services Center is located on the Fairfax Campus in the first-floor lobby of Student Union Building 1. In-person services including document drop-off* are offered on a walk-in basis Monday through Friday, 9am-5pm. To submit questions or documents to the Mason Student Services Center virtually, please visit mssc.gmu.edu and use the MSSC Virtual Services Check-In Link. 

*Please note: With the exception of citizenship documentation or V4/V5 worksheets that need to be presented in-person at the MSSC, all financial aid verification documents including tax returns and schedules must be submitted online in Patriot Forms. The MSSC cannot accept verification documents in-person or via the MSSC case submission link. 

Below is an overview of services offered by the Mason Student Services Center: 
 

Registration and Enrollment

Assistance with registration and schedule changes
Assistance with re-enrollment to Mason after an absence
Changes of Major/Minor/Concentration
Assistance in obtaining Enrollment Verification

Financial Aid

Assistance identifying outstanding requirements
Status and explanation of financial aid awards
Scholarship information

Billing and Payments

Assistance navigating various methods of payment
Explanation of charges and payments on student’s account
Payment Plan enrollment
Refund inquiries

Academic Records and other Student Services

Document collection for Student Accounts and the Registrar’s Office
Transcript inquiries
Transfer Credit Tools
Advisor and Department locations and referrals

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where can I find Mason Facts and Figures?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Enrollment, degrees offered, faculty information and more can be found at https://oiep.gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Does George Mason have a dual enrollment program for local high school students?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The George Mason University Department of Mathematical Sciences partnership with Fairfax County Public Schools offers exceptionally talented high school students the opportunity to earn advanced university-level mathematics credit. All courses are taught by Mason affiliate faculty and are offered on-site in FCPS high schools.

Please refer to the FCPS Math Dual Enrollment Program website for more information regarding eligibility requirements, application, and courses offered.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where can I find my G Number?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you are an applicant, please check the profile section in your application portal https://www2.gmu.edu/admissions-aid/how-apply/application-status; your G Number, also known as the student ID, can be found there.

If you are a current student, you can confirm your G Number by logging into your PatriotWeb account and selecting the "Personal Information" tab.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I authorize the Student Accounts Office to discuss my student account information with other person(s) or organizations?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The Family Education Rights and Privacy Act of 1974 (FERPA) provides privacy protection of a student’s educational record and restricts the release of those records without the student’s consent. Students who would like the Student Accounts Office to discuss their account with other person(s) or organization(s) must complete the FERPA Consent to Release Student Information form, which can be found at: https://registrar.gmu.edu/forms/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I request a copy of my disciplinary records?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please visit https://studentconduct.gmu.edu/contact-us/disciplinary-records-requests/ for information on requesting disciplinary records.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What are Mason's grading policies?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
George Mason University's grading policy for all students can be found at https://catalog.gmu.edu/policies/academic/grading.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How can I check to see if I have a hold on my record?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
To view any holds you may have on your record, you will need to log into Patriot Web and click on "Student Services," "Student Records," then "View Holds." If there is a hold on your record, please contact the department that placed the hold on your account in order to resolve the issue.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

What is a 'HO' housing exemption hold?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

First time freshmen are required to fill out an exemption form or complete a housing application. Students who have not taken one of these actions will see an 'HO' hold on their account, which prevents registration. 

In order to have the hold removed, the student must fill out the exemption form, located in the Mason Housing Portal. Upon completion of the form, the hold will be lifted within 1-2 business days by Housing.  Students who have difficulty completing the form should contact Housing and Residence Life at housing@gmu.edu or at 703-773-2720.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What am I allowed to bring to campus housing?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Download a packing list and view a list of items that you are not permitted to bring here. Be sure to coordinate with your roommates on items that can be shared such as rugs, mini-fridges, appliances and decor.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My housing agreement release was approved but the charges on my student account have not been adjusted/removed.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Any changes to your housing bill will be initiated by Housing who will then notify the Student Accounts Office. Once initiated by Housing it can take 3-5 business days for your student account to reflect the adjustment. Adjustments must be initiated by Housing and Student Accounts is unable to make account adjustments based on housing emails forwarded by students.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I cancel my housing agreement?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Housing Agreement Release Request

Prior to submitting an agreement release request, we encourage you to review the Housing and Dining agreement you signed for the applicable academic year.

To request release from your housing agreement, you must submit an Agreement Release Request form. This form must be submitted in the Housing Portal by the semester deadline (November 1st for Fall and April 1st for Spring). Your submission must include the following: 
 
The rationale for your release, detailing the extenuating circumstances that arose since the signing of your agreement that does not permit you to continue within Housing at Mason. 
Provide third-party supporting documentation that demonstrates the change of circumstance you’ve indicated. 
Decisions will be sent to students at their Mason email address approximately two weeks after submission. If approved for a release, refunds are based on the release approval date and official check-out date. Please visit the Housing Cancellation page for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Who do I contact if I have questions about my housing charges?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The main Housing and Residence Life Office is located in Piedmont/Tidewater and housing staff are available Monday – Friday, 9am to 5pm.

Location: Piedmont/Tidewater Hall Ground Floor
Mailing Address: 4400 University Dr., MS 3F6, Fairfax, VA 22030 

Main office number: 703-993-2720
Housing email: housing@gmu.edu
Website: https://housing.gmu.edu

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Are there any additional fees related to housing?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Additional fees outside of regular room charges may be assessed for the following:
Room fines (typically for room damages)
Improper checkout
Failure to return a loaner card
Winter break/early arrival charges

Additional information, including a list of possible charges that could be assessed at check-out, can be found here .

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I live on campus during the summer?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Students enrolled in summer course(s) may apply for summer housing. Students may only live on campus during the weeks that their summer course(s) are being offered. The summer housing application is available mid-April in the Housing Portal. Summer housing rates and room types can be found here.

For additional questions about housing for summer, please email housing@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When is my housing bill due?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Housing charges are billed per semester and are due by the payment deadline set by the Student Accounts Office. Typically, the payment deadline is the first day of classes for the term. To view semester due dates, visit the Student Accounts Calendar.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where do returning, transfer and graduate students pay their housing deposit?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Returning, new transfer, and graduate students should submit their housing deposit through their Mason Housing Portal. For additional information, visit the Housing Deposit page.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where do new, incoming freshman students pay their Housing Deposit?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Incoming freshman students should submit their housing deposit/fee in the Admissions Deposit Portal.
Visit Housing Deposit Instructions for additional housing deposit information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How much does it cost to live on-campus?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Housing charges vary depending on room assignment. The Paying for Housing site lists current and pending housing rates as they are updated.

Meal plan costs are available on the Dining Services site.  The top tab, “My Meal Plan” will allow you to adjust the academic year that you are viewing. Please note that a student’s room assignment may affect their eligibility for certain plans.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Does it cost extra to be part of a Learning Community (LC)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. It does not cost extra to be a part of a Learning Community. The only cost related to an LC is the cost of your room & board on campus. Visit https://housing.gmu.edu/learning-communities for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Do I need to live on campus to participate in a Learning Community (LC)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Yes, for the 2023-2024 academic year, students must live on campus in order to participate in a Learning Community. 
Visit https://housing.gmu.edu/learning-communities for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Are students required to live on campus?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
All first-time undergraduate students starting in the fall semester are required to live on campus. Some students are eligible for an exemption. Visit Exemption Request Process for additional information.

Students starting in the spring semester are not required to live on campus and do not need to submit an exemption request.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What if my parent/legal guardian does not want me to live in gender-inclusive housing?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
We encourage all students to maintain an open dialogue with their families regarding housing decisions. Students over the age of 18 are legally able to make decisions about their housing agreements without parental consent. Students under 18 should discuss housing plans with their families, as they will be required to have parental consent.

For additional information, please visit Gender Inclusive Housing.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I know my roommate will be ok with my Emotional Support Animal (ESA)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

If your ESA was approved prior to your housing placement, Housing will place them with student(s) who said they were ok living with that species of animal on their housing application. If your ESA is approved after assignment/move in and the roommate(s) are not ok living with the animal, the student with the ESA will be the one relocated.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

Can I live on campus during winter break?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students who wish to stay in housing over winter break must submit a Winter Break Application. The application will be available in the Housing Portal in early November and closes on December 1st. Only students with fall and spring housing assignments are eligible to apply for winter break housing. 

Students who are approved will be charged a flat fee which will be billed to their student account. Students not approved to stay over winter break will have their tap card access turned off and are not permitted to be in the residence halls during this time.

Please contact Housing with questions related to winter break housing.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When can graduate students apply for housing located on the Fairfax campus (Townhouses/Angel Cabrera Global Center)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

The Graduate Student Housing Application is available mid-April in the Housing Portal. 

The housing application for current graduate residents opens at the end of March in the Housing Portal. Students currently housed in Fairfax campus graduate housing will have the option to select their current space for the upcoming academic year or select a new space.

Students cannot select a space on the Fairfax campus and then transfer to the Manassas campus. Once students make their housing selection, they are unable to cancel their housing without penalty and are responsible for all charges related to their assignment.

For additional information, please visit Graduate Housing Options.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When can graduate students apply for housing located on the SciTech campus (Beacon Hall)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

The housing application for current graduate residents opens at the end of March in the Housing Portal. Students currently housed on the SciTech campus will have the option to select their current space or a new space on the SciTech campus for the upcoming academic year.

Note that students cannot select a space on the SciTech campus and then transfer to the Fairfax campus. Once students make their housing selection, they are unable to cancel their housing without penalty and are responsible for all charges related to their assignment.

Please visit Graduate Housing Options for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is there housing available for Graduate students?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Graduate housing is offered on both the Fairfax and Sci Tech campus. Beacon Hall is located on the Sci Tech campus and serves as the primary housing location for graduate students. Graduate housing on the Fairfax campus is limited, with graduate students housed in the Townhouses and the Angel Cabrera Global Center.

Visit Graduate Housing Options for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When can new, transfer students apply for housing?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The housing application for new transfer students opens mid-April for the upcoming academic year. Housing is not guaranteed for transfer students. Students must sign the housing agreement, pay the pre-payment and complete the application by the deadline to be eligible for housing selection. Students will receive an update on their application in May.

Spring-only housing applications open in November and housing is not guaranteed. Students will receive updates to their Mason email address in December.

For additional information visit the Transfer Student section of the Housing website.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is housing guaranteed for returning students?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Current residential students (living on campus in the fall semester or studying abroad in an approved program) are eligible for the returning student housing selection process. The application opens mid-December in the Housing Portal. Students must sign the housing agreement, pay the pre-payment and complete the application by the deadline to be eligible for housing selection. Students who complete the application after the deadline will be housed based on availability. 

For additional information, visit https://housing.gmu.edu/apply/returning-students.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

Are first year students guaranteed on-campus housing?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
First year undergraduate students starting in the fall semester who complete the housing application by the May 1 deadline will be guaranteed housing. Students who complete the application after the deadline will be housed based on availability. Visit https://housing.gmu.edu/apply/new-students for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where can I find a list of important housing dates and deadlines?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Application availability dates, deadlines and more can be found at: https://housing.gmu.edu/important-dates.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When is the housing application for returning students available?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The housing application for returning students opens in mid-December in the Housing Portal. Please visit Important Dates for additional information including housing application deadlines.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

Can I request an exemption of the first-year housing requirement?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Some students may be eligible for a housing exemption. Reasons for granting an exemption include students who live with their legal guardian in close proximity to campus, are married, have a dependent child or are 20 years of age by the first day of classes. Other circumstances will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis. First time students starting in the spring semester are not required to live on campus and do not need to submit an exemption. The exemption application is available in the Housing Portal when the housing application opens in mid-December.

For additional information please visit Apply for an Exemption.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

What is a Learning Community (LC)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A Learning Community (LC) is a group of students intentionally living together on campus who have a shared interest. Mason offers three types of LCs: Academic, Identity, and Interest. 

All LCs are led by a team of supportive students and staff committed to providing members with a space for personal growth and academic excellence. When living in an LC, students will join like-minded peers to explore their passion areas on a deeper level, connect to vital campus resources, and grow both in and out of the classroom. Students in the same learning communities live together in a residence hall, which makes it easier to make connections within the Mason community.

For additional information, visit our Learning Community FAQs.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is Gender Inclusive Housing?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Gender Inclusive housing is sometimes referred to as ‘GI’ or ‘CoEd’ housing. Living in Gender Inclusive housing means that you could share a bedroom with someone who identifies as a different gender identity than you. You will be asked in your housing application if you are requesting gender inclusive housing. If you answer’ yes’, you are agreeing to live with any student who is also requesting gender inclusive housing, regardless of gender identity. This means that you would select/be assigned to a CoEd space on campus.

Gender Inclusive does not refer to residence hall floors. Most floors on campus are CoEd, regardless of whether the room or suite/apartment is gender inclusive. Students who do NOT select GI will only share a bathroom with the same gender identity.

Students are required to agree to a set of statements and watch a video within the application to show they have read and understood the terms of GI housing before proceeding with the application. Once application completed (or after May 1st for first-year freshmen) students cannot change their gender inclusive answer.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I register my Emotional Support Animal?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Emotional Support Animals (ESA) must be approved by The Office of Disability Services. Please visit https://ds.gmu.edu/ for information regarding the intake process and for the required forms/documentation.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I apply for housing accommodations?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

All housing accommodations are reviewed by The Office of Disability Services. Please visit https://ds.gmu.edu/housing/ for information regarding the intake process and for the required forms/documentation.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is Extended Stay Housing?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Extended stay periods are offered when the university calendar allows and are not guaranteed before or after the start of each semester. Should Housing and Residence Life be able to offer extended stay or early arrival for each semester, that information will be included in the Important Dates section of the Housing and Residence Life website.

Students who may be eligible include spring Mason residents who are registered for summer school sessions that start immediately, graduating seniors, or those who are approved for Intern Housing.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is housing available for off-campus students?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Mason only offers on-campus housing to full-time undergraduate and graduate students.

Off-campus housing and renter's resources can be found on the Contemporary Student Services website.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is housing for graduate students guaranteed?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Graduate student housing is not guaranteed. Visit Graduate Housing Options for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When do first year/freshman apply for housing?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
First year students starting in the fall semester are required to complete the housing application on the Housing Portal. The application will open mid-December and the priority deadline is May 1st. Students who complete the application after the deadline will be housed based on availability. A list of housing steps for first year students can be found at https://housing.gmu.edu/apply/new-students.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Why does George Mason University wait to bill the VA until after the add/drop deadline?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
George Mason participates in dual certification, which allows our veterans to start receiving their BAH and book stipend sooner, while significantly reducing the amount of over-payments and debt issues associated with class and schedule changes.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I have questions about using my VMSDEP benefits at Mason.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
VMSDEP (Virginia Military Survivors and Dependent Education Program) is a Commonwealth of Virginia Program which provides education benefits to spouses and children of military service members killed, missing in action, taken prisoner, or who became totally and permanently disabled or at least 90 percent permanently disabled as a result of military service in covered military combat.

Benefits:

Tuition/Fee Waiver - Eligible students, as confirmed by DVS, are guaranteed waiver of all tuition and required fees for four academic years or the equivalent. The Student Accounts Office applies the tuition waiver to the student's account. 

Stipend - Eligible students may receive a stipend to offset other educational expenses. SCHEV works with DVS and the public colleges and universities in disbursing funds for authorized stipend. The amount of the stipend is determined annually by SCHEV and is dependent on the student's enrollment status; the number of participating students; and the available funding. The Mason Financial Aid Office processes the stipend which is then issued to the student as a refund. 

Depending on the tier that the student falls into, they may be eligible for the tuition waiver only (tier 1) or the waiver and the stipend (tier 2). Students who have already applied and received their confirmation from DVS should know which tier they fall into. 

Students may file the VMSDEP application online through the Virginia Department of Military Services, which also has complete information about the program and its requirements.

The Mason Office of Military Services can assist with answering student questions related to the benefit and providing details for using the VMSDEP Portal.

Note that Mason must receive approval either in the portal or directly from DVS before the tuition benefit (exemption) can be applied to the student's account.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I receive Post 9/11 (Chapter 33) GI Bill benefits?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please refer to the Registrar’s Office website for complete instructions on initiating your benefits: https://registrar.gmu.edu/students/certifications/veterans/. Student may also contact the Office of Military Services with questions.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where do I submit my Certificate of Eligibility (COE)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Students should submit their COE at military.gmu.edu/benefits/va-benefits.  This online form ensures that the Office of Military Services has all of the information that is needed for to create an account for the student with the VA.

After the student enrolls in classes, the next step is to complete a Veterans Registration Reporting Form (VRRF), which is available at military.gmu.edu or at registrar.gmu.edu/forms/vrrf/. This form is a request to use your benefit in a given semester, and must be filled out and submitted before the first day of class in each semester you wish to use your benefit. The first VRRF you submit each semester is a “New Request”. Changes to your class schedule should be submitted as “Change to Previous Registration” in the drop-down menu. If your schedule does change, we also ask that you provide a brief description of that adjustment to your schedule in the “Additional Comments” box. Submitting a VRRF will generate an automated confirmation to your Mason e-mail account; if you do not receive that e-mail, please contact the Office of Military Services to verify your submission.

Please note that VRRFs are processed in the order they are received, so earlier submission of your initial request is always preferred.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Why do I have to pay my enrollment deposit if I am covered by the GI Bill?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The enrollment deposit is the financial commitment a prospective student makes to attend Mason. The VA will not pay for the enrollment deposit because it is refundable and can be returned to the student after the student is in attendance or used to offset other financial obligations.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Why did I receive information stating Mason did not certify my tuition and fees?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
In accordance with VA net tuition requirements, certification without tuition and fees is first completed by The Registrar’s Office. After the deadline to drop classes, the Third Party Billing Office amends the certification by adding tuition and fees. This process reduces overpayments and debt issues while expediting other payments from the VA, such as BAH and book stipends.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the VRRF and when do I have to submit it?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The VRRF is the Veterans Registration Reporting Form. Eligible students are required to submit this form to have classes certified for veteran education benefits. The VRRF must be submitted after students register for classes at the beginning of every semester, and anytime a schedule change is made.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I submit a request to have my classes certified for VA benefits?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
To request that your courses be certified, please submit a Veterans Registration and Reporting Form (VRRF) before the first day of class each semester you attend. If you change your schedule after turning this form in, you must file a change request.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I submitted a Veteran Registration Reporting Form (VRRF), how long will it be before it's processed?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Per VA compliance, all VRRFs submitted prior to the start of the term will be processed no later than 30 days after the start of the term. Any VRRF submitted after the start of the term will be processed in the order received and roughly 30 days from VRRF submission date.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

What is the deadline to adjust my course schedule?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Add/drop deadlines can be found in the Academic Calendar. The date to drop courses with a full or partial tuition refund will vary depending on the course schedule.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I verify my enrollment?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

George Mason University has authorized the National Student Clearinghouse (NSC) to provide enrollment and degree verification.  Students can receive free enrollment verifications through Patriot Web.  The enrollment verification certificate may be attached to any form provided by a third party and returned directly to the requester. 

Employers should go directly to the NSC to request degree verifications.


Enrollment Verification Certificates provide the following information:

Enrollment status/dates
Expected graduation date

Enrollment certification certificates can be used for insurance companies, scholarships, prospective employment, military identification cards, and proof of enrollment for other purposes.
 

Requesting Verification

1. Log on to Patriot Web
2. Select "Student Services"
3. Select "Student Records"
4. Select "Order Enrollment Verification"
5. You will then be connected to the National Student Clearinghouse Student Self-Service site  
6. Select "Current Enrollment", "All Enrollment" or "Advanced Registration"
7. Click on "Obtain an enrollment certificate"   
8. A PDF of your enrollment information will be generated.  Either save the verification or open and print it.  

Please Note: Prior to the term start date the Advanced Registration option may show enrollment updates not reflected with the Current enrollment option.   


Other Requests

For all other requests, complete the Enrollment Verification Request Form . Completed forms can be returned to the Mason Student Services Center, or emailed to verify@gmu.edu.

Please allow two business days for processing. Processing time may be longer during peak periods, (graduation, the priority registration period etc.).

Requests for certifications that can be satisfied by submitting an enrollment verification or transcript (official or unofficial) to a third party will not be processed.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I prevent my student records from being released?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Students may give written instruction to prevent the release of their educational records to a third party by completing the online Request to Prevent Disclosure of Student Information Form. Students can rescind this by submitting the same form, which will then allow the release of directory information from that point going forward.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I give consent to release my educational records?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Students may give written consent to release their protected educational records to a third party by completing the online Consent to Release Student Information Form. Students can rescind their consent at any time, which will prevent the release of that information from that point going forward, by submitting the same form.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I am an incoming transfer student and I am currently classified as a sophomore. With my spring and summer classes at my current school I will end up with over 60 credits before starting at Mason in the fall. Can my registration time ticket be reissued as a junior?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Incoming transfer students are issued a registration time ticket corresponding with the date of the first transfer orientation rather than credits completed.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

Can I change my name on my diploma?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

The diploma name defaults to a student’s legal name on file with the University. If a student would like to choose how their name will appear on their diploma, they will be given this opportunity when they complete a Graduation Application. If a student wants to change their diploma name after submitting their Graduation Application they would need to submit the “Diploma Name and Accent Mark Request- online form” found here: https://registrar.gmu.edu/forms/.

 

The addition of a diploma name is only for inclusion on the diploma and does not modify any name in the system of record.  
If an update to the legal name recorded in the system of record is required, a Change of Personal Information request must be submitted. 
Graduates have until their degree conferral date to update their diploma name which is posted under the Graduation Timelines.  
Updates made after conferral require you to order a replacement diploma.  Standard fees will apply.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is orientation mandatory?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes, Orientation is mandatory for all new students before they begin their first semester at Mason. There are many benefits to attending orientation – students will meet faculty, staff, and administrators, speak with an academic advisor, register for classes, meet other students, learn more about campus life and support resources, and develop even more Patriot Pride!

Please visit https://orientation.gmu.edu for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I check the status of my waitlisted course?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Important information about the waitlist process can be found in this Waitlist Guide. Note that waitlists overrides remain on your account for 48 hours and are removed from your record if you do not use them within the 48-hour time period. Please review the Waitlist Guide carefully for detailed instructions.

Instructions for checking your position on the waitlist can be found in the Waitlist Position Tutorial.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I request a confidential hold on my student records?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Currently enrolled students may elect to withhold disclosure of their student record information under FERPA by submitting a Request to Prevent Disclosure of Student Information. This form adds a confidential hold to the student's record. Students can rescind a confidential hold at any time by submitting another Request to Prevent Disclosure of Student Information form, which will allow the release of directory information from that point going forward.

Former students and alumni should contact the FERPA Compliance Office at ferpa@gmu.edu for instructions on submitting a request.  

If you place a Confidential Hold on your student record,
Your name will not appear in the commencement program
Verification of enrollment, graduation, or degrees awarded will not be provided to third parties, including potential employers and insurance companies
Students who elect this hold must conduct all university business in person with a photo ID or via their official Mason email address
No student information will be released over the phone

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Are there priority registration dates (time tickets) for the summer term?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. There are no priority registration dates assigned for the summer term. Priority registration dates are only assigned for the fall and spring terms. 

After time tickets are published for the fall and spring terms, you may view your registration time in Patriot Web. View this tutorial on how to find your registration time ticket in Patriot Web.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I resolve a pre-requisite/test score error when registering for a course?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you receive a pre-requisite/test score error, you may not have met the required prerequisite or test core requirements for this course. You will need to contact the department for the course directly to confirm why you are receiving this error. (For example, you will contact the math department if it is a math class.)

If the department so chooses, they may issue you a pre-requisite override which will allow you to register for the course.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I submitted a Change of Major request after the last day to add classes for the current term. I need to apply for graduation but I do not see my new major listed in the application.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Approved Change of Major requests will be effective the following semester if not received by the MSSC/Registrar’s Office by the last day to add classes for the current term.

If you are applying to graduate and do not see the new major as an option when you apply, please first register for classes in the new semester. After registering, you will see your new curricula as an option in the graduation application.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I get a letter that states that I did not complete my degree?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Your official transcript is the document you need to demonstrate that you have not earned a degree. For more information about obtaining a transcript, please visit our website: https://registrar.gmu.edu/students/transcripts-parchment. Alternatively, you can request a degree verification from the National Student Clearinghouse that will indicate enrollment only. For more information visit www.degreeverify.org.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What information can Mason release without my consent?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Directory Information is information Mason may release without a student's consent, but is not required to release. You can find the full list of what Mason considers to be directory information at https://registrar.gmu.edu/ferpa/, in the annual notification, and on the University Policy website. If you do not want this information to be released, place a confidential hold on your account by filling out a Request to Prevent Disclosure of Student Information Form.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What if I have questions about the information reflected on my enrollment certification?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you have questions about the information reflected on your enrollment certification, please contact verify@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can my parents conduct business for me if I am not able to?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Any third party may submit proof to Mason that a student is sick, in the hospital, in jail or otherwise unavailable to conduct school business, to enable Mason to take appropriate action. However, the school may not share information back with that third party unless we have the student's consent on file.

Students may give written consent to release their protected educational records to a third party by completing a Consent to Release Student Information Form and submitting it to the Office of the University Registrar.  Students can rescind their consent at any time, which will prevent the release of that information from that point going forward.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My DegreeWorks audit is not loading
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Disable the pop-up blocker; clear browser caches or try a different browser (Firefox works best).

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I verify that I earned a degree?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The National Student Clearinghouse is the University’s Authorized Certifying Agent to provide degree and enrollment verifications for alumni, credentialing firms, prospective employers, and other third party requestors. Verifications can be ordered 24 hours a day from www.degreeverify.org or the Clearinghouse website. Alumni also can request degree and enrollment verifications in the form of a transcript.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I received the error message "Duplicate CRN." How can I register for the course?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
This CRN is already listed on your course schedule.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I received the error message "Duplicate CRSE WITH SECT XXX." How can I register for the course?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
You may not register for two sections of this course. If you wish to change sections, first verify that space is available in the new section, then drop the original section and add the new section.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I received the error message "Closed." How can I register for the course?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
This course has reached maximum enrollment. Choose "Waitlist" if the option is open, or search for another course.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I have my domicile classification changed for previous semesters?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. Mason cannot accept appeals for previous terms.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How will I receive my domicile appeal decision?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
All communications regarding your appeal, including decisions, will be sent to your Mason email account, so please check it regularly.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Are there domicile exceptions for active duty, military, veterans, or their families?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
There are multiple ways active duty, veterans, surviving spouses, and dependents might qualify for in-state classification. The best way to know if you are eligible for in-state tuition is to submit a Domicile Appeal. Please contact the Office of Military Services for information regarding other veteran benefits or the veteran certification process.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Who can I contact if I have questions about the domicile appeals process and eligibility?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Most questions can be answered by going to the Domicile Appeals website. If you still have questions, please contact domicile@gmu.edu for assistance.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I want to audit a course. What do I have to do?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
You will need to fill out the Course Audit form and the instructor will need to sign and approve you taking the course for audit. The Course Audit form must be submitted to the Office of the Registrar before the drop deadline for the term. If the drop deadline has passed, you will need dean's approval to audit a course. 

If you would like to change your course status from Audit back to Credit, you can do so. If the drop deadline for the term has not passed, the Course Audit form will need to be resubmitted with the instructor's signature and approval. If the deadline has passed, the form will require dean's signature.

If you would like to audit a course you previously passed, you will still need to submit the Course Audit form with instructor approval. The final grade for an audited course will appear on a student's transcript as AU and tuition and fees for audited courses are the same as courses taken for credit. 

For more important information regarding auditing courses, please refer to the Registrar's website: https://registrar.gmu.edu/topics/audit/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Does Mason offer distance learning courses?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Distance education provides students with the opportunity to take the same classes offered on campus, but in a non-traditional format. Distance education courses have textbooks, assignments, exams, student-centered interaction, and other features to encourage success. Communication with the instructor and classmates is usually electronic via email or online discussion boards. Some courses use real-time two-way audio with application sharing software.

Students who are stationed abroad, or constantly travelling may wish to enroll in a fully online program. For more information on how to enroll as a full-time online student, please visit http://masononline.gmu.edu/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I am a PhD student working on my dissertation. How can I maintain full-time or half-time equivalent status?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Doctoral students enrolled in 6 credits of 998 or 999 are considered full-time. After advancement to candidacy and completion of one semester of 999 (3 credits minimum), students may then be eligible for full-time/half-time status beginning the following term with 1 credit of 999 if they have completed the minimum number of credits required by their degree program including the minimum number of credits of 998 and 999 required by the university and their program.

If you meet all of the above qualifications, please submit the "Full-Time/Half-Time Equivalent Status - Doctoral Dissertation Research" form to your academic department for approval. This form must be submitted every semester.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I verify my major or minor?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
You can view your declared degree program on PatriotWeb by going to the "Student Services" tab then "Student Records" and "View Your Unofficial Transcript". 

If you need official verification of your degree program, you can order your official transcript. For more information about obtaining a transcript, please visit http://registrar.gmu.edu/students/transcripts/

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I prevent my email from being released?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Your email is private unless you choose to disclose it, or give Mason consent to do so through the HB1 Opt-In Form.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I'm completing the domicile appeal; who can be considered a “legal guardian”?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A legal guardianship can only be created by court order. Living with a relative other than your parents who supports you, or a power of attorney does not create a guardianship.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I submit my appeal via email?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. You must submit an appeal by completing the Request for Tuition Reclassification Form.

Check your Mason email account regularly for requests for additional information, and your decision. Late requests will not be accepted.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
The day my class meets is TR, what day is this?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
TR means the class meets on Tuesdays and Thursdays. The codes for the days of the week can be found by going to registrar.gmu.edu and clicking on "Students," "Registration," then "Days of the week codes."

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
If my domicile appeal is granted, can I get a refund?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Yes. If your appeal is granted, you may request a refund for the difference between the in-state and out-of-state rates or apply the credit balance to the next semester. To obtain a Refund Request Form, please visit https://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/forms/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can changing my domicile effect my financial aid award?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes. A change in residency can result in an adjustment or cancellation of your Financial Aid Award. Contact the Office of Student Financial Aid with any aid related questions.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I am an out-of-state student, but I should be in-state. How do I submit a request for tuition reclassification?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Instructions and the form can be found on the Domicile Appeals website.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How will I be notified if I receive a waitlist override?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students are notified by e-mail once a waitlist override is issued. It is strongly encouraged for students to check their Patriot Web account once a day where waitlist overrides can be viewed via by clicking on “Registration and Planning,” “Prepare for Registration,” “Select a Term,” then “Registration Status.”

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I withdraw from the University?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
For undergraduate students, there is no official withdrawal policy from the University. Graduate students should talk to their advisor about a Voluntary Resignation from their program.

All students should refer to the "Before Leaving Mason" form on the Registrar's website for more information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I have a hold on my account and received an override, what can I do to add this course?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
You will need to resolve your hold prior to the expiration of your override. Please contact the department that placed the hold on your account in order to resolve the issue. If it is a hold that prevents registration activity, you will not be able to add the course(s) with an active hold on your record.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My waitlist override expired and I didn’t use it, what do I do now?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If your waitlist override expired, you will need to add yourself back to the waitlist and wait for another override. Please refer to the Registrar's Waitlist Guidelines for instructions on how to add yourself back to the waitlist.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How long do I have to use a waitlist override?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
You will have 48 hours to use your waitlist override. The last override will be issued on the last day of add/drop for that part of term. If you are given an override on the last day to add classes, you will only have until 11:59pm that day to add the class. Please refer to the Registrar's Waitlist Guide for instructions on how to use your waitlist override.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
If I am on the waitlist for a course, am I guaranteed to be issued an override?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
