No, waitlist overrides are issued when seats become available. There is no guarantee you will be issued an override prior to the start of the semester.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How will I be assigned my time ticket for registration?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A student's registration time ticket is assigned based on class code and in order of completed credit hours from most to least. You can read more about registration time tickets here: https://registrar.gmu.edu/topics/time-tickets/ .

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When can I begin registering for courses?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students can verify their registration time ticket on PatriotWeb. Please refer to the Registrar's website for a video tutorial on how to find your registration time ticket. 

Students should also ensure that they have no active holds on their record that prevent registration. Holds can be viewed on PatriotWeb by going to the "Student Services" tab followed by "Student Records" then "View Holds."

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I get a letter that states the number of online courses I am taking?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students who need a letter stating how many online courses they are taking or have completed should submit their request to their academic department. Contact information for academic advisors by major can be found here: https://advising.gmu.edu/current-student/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I get a letter that states that I was never a student at Mason?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please contact the verification team in the Office of the Registrar by sending an email to verify@gmu.edu to request your letter.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I am a Mason student and want to participate in consortium, what tuition rate do I pay?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you are a Mason student, you will pay the Mason tuition rate and tuition payment is submitted to Mason. Additional fees, such as lab or course materials, are the student’s responsibility and must be paid to the visited institution.  Parking fees at the visited institution are also the student’s responsibility.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How many credit hours do I need to register for to be considered full time?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
For graduate students, 9 hours or more are considered full time. For undergraduate students, 12 hours or more is considered full time.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I am a graduate assistant and I am enrolled in 6 credit hours. How do I get my status updated to full time?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Your department should be able to help you. Graduate students with assistantships of 20 hours per week are considered full‐time when they are registered for at least 6 hours of graduate credit. Human Resources (HR) requires departments to enter the hours per pay period on Electronic Personnel Approval Forms (EPAFs) for all Graduate Teaching Assistant/Graduate Research Assistant (GTA/GRA) appointments. This data in combination with the hours of appropriate coursework will be used to determine student time status automatically. Any questions should be addressed to your department HR Liaison.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Will an audit course count toward my earned hours?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
When auditing a course, the credit hours will not count towards attempted or earned hours.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How can I receive or view my child's grades?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
George Mason University does not mail grades to students or to their parents. Grades are available for students to view online through Patriot Web. Students wishing to share their grades with their parents can submit a request for a transcript, which then will be mailed to an address of their choice or delivered electronically.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What happens to my educational records after I graduate?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Mason stores your information according to state and federal laws. FERPA protected information (grades, classes, GPA, coursework, etc.) will remain confidential unless you give Mason permission to release it.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is my parent allowed to see my educational records if they pay my tuition?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
When a student turns 18, or attends a postsecondary institution, FERPA rights belong to the student, not the parent. In general, Mason does not disclose non-directory information to third parties unless the student has provided consent, the release is to the parent of a dependent student, as required by § 23.1-1303.B.5 of the Code of Virginia, or the disclosure meets a qualified exception under FERPA.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Are professors allowed to speak to my parents?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
You can give consent to allow your professors to speak to your parents, however, Mason is not required to disclose information to anyone but the student and may decline to speak with them.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I bring a parents when I meet with my advisor?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
You may give consent for your parent to attend an advising meeting, however, Mason is not required to disclose information to anyone but the student and may decline to meet with them.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I bring another person with me when I meet with my advisor?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
You may give consent for another person to attend an advising meeting, however, Mason is not required to disclose information to anyone but the student and may decline meeting with them if they choose.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Who is allowed to access my educational records at Mason?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Only those individuals employed by Mason, or doing work on behalf of Mason, can access private student records. And only if they have a legitimate educational reason to do so.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I place a confidential hold on my account?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students may give written instruction to prevent the release of their educational records to a third party by completing the Request to Prevent Disclosure of Student Information Form and submitting it to the Office of the University Registrar. Students can rescind a hold at any time, which will allow the release of directory information from that point going forward.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can my spouse conduct business for me if I am not able to?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Any third party may submit proof to Mason that a student is sick, in the hospital, in jail or otherwise unavailable to conduct school business, to enable Mason to take appropriate action. However, the school may not share information back with that third party unless we have the student's consent on file.

Students may give written consent to release their protected educational records to a third party by completing a Consent to Release Student Information Form and submitting it to the Office of the University Registrar.  Students can rescind their consent at any time, which will prevent the release of that information from that point going forward.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can my parents do things for me at Mason, like register or drop me from a class?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. Parents may never act on behalf of, or in place of, the student.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I access my 1098-T online?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Log in to the Bill + Payment with your net ID and password to retrieve the information from your 1098-T.

A PDF guide for retrieving your 1098-T can be found here.

 

1098-T FAQs are available at https://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/frequently-asked-questions/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

If I am due a refund, when will I receive those funds?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Refunds are generated when a student has a credit on their account from an overpayment or dropped class. 

 

Dropped courses/non-financial aid refunds:

Refunds from dropped courses or other non-financial aid adjustments require a Refund Request form.

 

Financial Aid Refunds:

Refunds from excess financial aid will be automatically processed and therefore do not require a refund request form
Financial aid refunds are only issued after your financial aid payment has been applied to your account
Your financial aid disbursement date is not the date your refund will be issued. Students who are due a refund should allow 10-14 days for refund processing during peak volume periods.
Refunds are not issued based on pending or future financial aid awards

 

Note: If you are issued a refund and later adjust your course schedule or your financial aid is adjusted, you may be responsible for returning all or a portion of your refund. Please monitor your student account for any changes to your bill.

 

Refunds are issued by direct deposit or a mailed check. Direct deposit is strongly recommended as it is the fastest way to receive a refund payment. Instructions on how to enroll in direct deposit can be found here.

If you are not signed up for direct deposit, a paper refund check will be processed within 10-14 business days from the date of the submitted Refund Request form or financial aid disbursement and mailed to the address on file in PatriotWeb.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where/How do I pay my bill?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Payment options include check (online, mail, or drop box), online credit card payments and money orders.

International students may use Flywire or TransferMate to transfer funds to Mason.

Online payments must be made in the Bill+Pmt system. Note that Mason does not accept cash payments.

Current payment plan options may be viewed here.

Please visit the Payment Information page for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

What payment options are available for international students?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

George Mason University has partnered with TransferMate and Flywire to streamline the tuition payment process for our international students.

 

TransferMate provides a seamless international payments process through your online student account. Log into your student account, select ‘Make A Payment’, choose TransferMate from the dropdown menu, and follow prompts. For more information about making international payments using TransferMate, watch this video for a quick demo, or download step-by-step instructions here.

 

Flywire allows students to pay from any country and any bank. They also offer excellent foreign exchange rates, allowing you to pay in your home currency (in most cases) and save a significant amount of money, compared to traditional banks. You will be able to track the progress of your payment throughout the transfer process via a student dashboard and you will also be notified via email when your payment is received by Mason. For more information and to make an international payment, visit Flywire.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the Tuition Discount for Virginia Educators?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The College of Education and Human Development (CEHD) at George Mason University offers a tuition discount to Virginia Educators. The discount is 15% off the university's approved rate for in-state graduate students. Exclusion applies to courses that are already discounted, and fully online programs offered in 8-week modules. To receive the discount, students will need to submit the "Tuition Discount for Virginia Educators" form. 

Please visit https://cehd.gmu.edu/admissions/funding-sources-discounts/educator-tuition-discount for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

What Payment Plans are available?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Mason payment plans are available for students who need to pay their bill over scheduled installments. Payment plan options vary and a $30 nonrefundable contract fee is required at the time of enrollment. For up-to-date payment plan options and instructions for payment plan enrollment, please visit Payment Plans.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When will I receive my financial aid refund?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you have excess financial aid funds after your balance is paid in full, any refund due will be processed for mailing (paper check) in 7-10 business days. If you are enrolled in direct deposit for refunds, you can except your refund deposited to your bank account in 3-5 business days.

During high volume periods, refund processing may take longer than the times stated above.  

Students are highly encouraged to sign up for Direct Deposit of their refunds. A Direct Deposit PDF guide can be found here.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Are there payment plans available?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Deferred payment plans are available for enrollment in the Bill+Payment system. A $30 non-refundable contract fee is required at the time of enrollment. 

Please note that Study Abroad/Global Education fee payments cannot be deferred using a payment plan.

Available payment plans, FAQ's and a PDF guide can be found at https://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/payment-plans/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

What is included in Box 1 of the 1098-T Tuition Statement?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Box 1 of the 1098-T Tuition Statement consists of payments (student payments, scholarships, grants, stipends, loans, etc) towards qualified charges for educational expenses, including tuition, course fees, registration fees, and matriculation fees. Qualified charges do not include insurance, medical expenses, room and board, late penalties, transportation, and/or personal living expenses. Box 1 is capped by the total amount of qualified charges for the calendar year. 

Effective for the 2022 tax year, the cap does not include future Spring charges billed in the current tax year. 
This change was made to improve 1098-T reporting because it better aligns payments and scholarship/grant disbursements with associated tuition and fee charges.  This change does not impact how you would determine the amount to be reported on your tax return.  Since the Form 1098-T is an informational form only, the final decision for determining eligible educational expenses is the taxpayer’s responsibility.  If you have questions about eligibility, please check the IRS website, contact the IRS or discuss with a tax advisor.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Will my 1098-T be mailed to me or issued electronically?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The IRS requires that a mailed Form 1098-T be postmarked by January 31 of the following calendar year. This form is mailed to the preferred address of a student who was enrolled at Mason for at least half time during the calendar year. Address changes can be made on PatriotWeb.

Alternatively, you may opt to only receive an electronic 1098-T at Bill + Payment, under My Profile set up, Consents and Agreements. 1098-T forms will be available to view mid-January at Bill + Payment.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where can I get a receipt for payments made to Mason?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
On-Demand Billing Statements are available for printing in the Bill+Payment System and include a billing summary as well as a list of the student's courses.  

Please review the On-Demand Billing Statement Guidefor step-by-step instructions.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I make a credit card payment over the phone or in person?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. Payments using VISA, MasterCard, American Express, Discover Card, and electronic checks (from personal checking accounts only) can only be made using the Bill+Payment System. 

Please note that the Bill+Payment System is unavailable daily from 10:30 PM to 12:00 AM and Sundays from 7:00 AM to 11:15 AM (U.S. Eastern Time Zone) for maintenance.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I pay my bill at the Mason Cashier's Office?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The Mason Cashier’s Office does not offer in-person service. Students are encouraged to make payment online through the Bill & Payment System. 

Options for those who are not able to make payment online and who traditionally pay with cash can be found at https://cashiersoffice.gmu.edu/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I pay my Mason bill in-person, with cash?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

The Mason Cashier’s Office does not accept cash payments and does not offer in-person service. Students are encouraged to make payment online through the Bill & Payment System. 

Options for those who are not able to make payment online and who traditionally pay with cash can be found at https://cashiersoffice.gmu.edu/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I am getting a log-in error when I try to access the Bill+Payment System.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
There could be an issue with your password. First, ensure that your log-in is correct. For students, this is the same NetID and Password as you use for PatriotWeb.

If you need to change your password, visit https://password.gmu.edu/index.jsp. After changing your password, wait 30 minutes before you attempt to log-in again.

If your password is correct and you are still experiencing issues, clear your browser cache and/or use a different browser.

Please ensure your browser meets the minimum requirements for the Bill+Payment system: Microsoft Internet Explorer 7.0 or higher, Mozilla Firefox 2.0 or higher, or Apple Safari 3.0 or higher. JavaScript must be enabled.

For authorized users, the student may need to reset your access by resetting your information in the Bill+Payment System (delete user and then re-authorize to generate a new password).

Please note that the Student Accounts Office is not able to reset passwords for the Bill+Payment System.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is Direct Deposit available for Federal Parent PLUS loan refunds?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
During the Parent PLUS loan application process, a parent borrower may elect any excess PLUS loan funds (refund) to be issued to the student or to themselves (the parent borrower). If the parent chooses excess funds to be issued to themselves (the parent), a mailed refund check (paper) is the only method in which they will be issued a refund. The refund check will be mailed to the address the parent listed on their PLUS Loan application. Direct Deposit is not available for PLUS loan refunds issued to parent borrowers. 

If a parent borrower choses the student as recipient of excess PLUS funds, the student may sign up for Direct Deposit of those funds. 

Note: Graduate PLUS loan refunds are eligible for Direct Deposit to the student

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I submit my Mason Employee Tuition Waiver request?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
All Mason employees must submit their Employee Tuition Request form ONLINE. Instructions and the link for the online form can be found at https://hr.gmu.edu/tuition-exemption/ .

Note that pdf or printed copies of the employee's Tuition Request form will not be processed.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the maximum number of credits covered by the Employee Tuition Exemption Benefit?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The employee tuition exemption is applied for a maximum of 6 credits per semester however, the maximum allowable benefits for each employment classification may vary. Please visit https://hr.gmu.edu/tuition-exemption/ for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I need to pre-pay for a something in the Bill+Payment System. How do I make that payment if my current balance is $0?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Login to the Bill+Payment System . Choose 'Make a Payment', and then choose 'Current Account Balance'.

Next, change the entry field that shows your balance ($0) to the amount that you wish to pay.

Click the add button and then Continue. 

Example:




Proceed with selecting your Payment Method and submitting payment as outlined in the Bill+Payment Guide .

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When are Third Party Authorizations due?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Students must provide a third party authorization or government training voucher to the Third Party Billing Office before the due date (for payment schedule by semester, please see Calendars) and pay any remaining balance that the authorization may not cover. Otherwise, a late payment fee of up to $125 may be assessed.
 

Documentation must be submitted through the student portal below:
Financial Guarantee/Authorizations Student Portal


Note: If you are using a Mason computer and having trouble accessing the link, please try clearing your cache or try a different browser.
 

Prior to submitting an authorization, please read the Third Party Authorization Requirements and Tuition Assistance & Military Procedures for Students.  for Students. Students are ultimately responsible for any default in payment by the sponsoring agency.


Every student participating in the Third Party payment arrangement will be assessed a mandatory $25 Third Party Processing Fee each semester.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is there a process for appealing my tuition and fees?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
With the exception of a complete withdrawal by a student in the Armed Forces who is called to active duty and assigned to a duty station (see below), there is no process to appeal tuition and fees with the Student Accounts Office.

As such, students are strongly encouraged to consider purchasing Tuition Insurance through GradGuard.

GradGuard’s Tuition Protection Insurance Plan helps students and their families overcome the financial losses, including tuition and housing, that may result from events which force students to withdraw from the semester due to a covered medical reason. The deadline to purchase tuition insurance each term is up until the last day to add classes for the full semester. Visit Tuition Insurance for additional information.

A student in the Armed Forces who is called to active duty and assigned to a duty station, verifiable by a copy of Official Military Orders, will be allowed to receive a 100% reduction of tuition charges after a complete withdrawal is approved for classes that have not been completed. Requests should be sent to saccount@gmu.edu and should include student Gnumber with submission. Requests will not be considered beyond the end of term in which the student completely withdraws.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I view the terms/agreement of my payment plan?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
1) Log in to the Bill+Payment system.

2) Once logged in as a Student or Authorized User, click the payment plan type that displays under 'Payment Plans' (example below):




3) In the next page, click 'View Agreement':



After clicking 'View Agreement', the terms of your payment plan will display in the next page.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I would like to pay my bill with a paper check. What address should I mail the check to?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Checks may be mailed to:
George Mason University
P.O. Box # 716475
Philadelphia, PA 19171-6475

 
If payment is being sent for overnight delivery by courier, please send to:
Lockbox Services – #0076475
George Mason University
MAC Y1372-045
401 Market Street
Philadelphia, PA 21046


*Please make sure that the student’s ID number (G#) is included on the check or in correspondence with the check. Checks should be made payable to George Mason University. Allow 14 days for delivery and confirm receipt by accessing Patriot Web.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I lost my refund check. Can I request a replacement?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes. Please visit https://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/forms/ and submit the Stop Payment Request - online form. The Stop Payment Request may only be submitted online - paper forms cannot be accepted. 

Submitting this form authorizes the Student Accounts Office to place a Stop Payment on your refund check. Once the Student Accounts Office confirms that the check has not been cashed, they will proceed with reissuing your refund. 

Reissued payments will be processed within 15-20 business days from the request receipt date. 

It is strongly recommended that you sign up for Direct Deposit of your reissued and/or future refunds. Enroll in Direct Deposit by following these procedures.

If you prefer to continue receiving paper refund checks, please confirm that your address (refund recipient address) in Patriot Web is current.  This tutorial can guide you through the process.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I request Direct Deposit of my refund(s)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Instructions on how to enroll in direct deposit are located located here.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Do I need to submit a refund request for financial aid?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A refund request form is not needed for financial aid refunds. Overpayments from financial aid awards will automatically generate a refund. Your refund will be paid either by direct deposit (preferred) or paper check.  If you are not enrolled in direct deposit and would like to receive your refund faster, follow instructions in the direct deposit guide: http://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/wp-content/uploads/DirectDeposit.pdf available at studentaccounts.gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When will I receive a refund for account credits from non-financial aid sources, such as overpayments?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
After submitting a Refund Request Form, your refund will be processed within 10-14 business days. If you are not enrolled in direct deposit, your refund will be issued as a paper check and mailed to the address on file in PatriotWeb. Direct deposit payments will be automatically deposited into your bank account. Direct Deposit is the fastest way to receive your refund payment. Instructions on how to enroll in direct deposit can be found here. For more information, please review the refund process guide.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I want to purchase Tuition Insurance through GradGuard. Will I pay for that along with my tuition bill, on my Mason student account?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. Tuition Insurance purchased through GradGuard is paid directly to GradGuard. 

Visit GradGuard.com/Tuition/GMU for additional information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is my balance?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Balances may be verified via Patriot Web or the Bill+Payment System. For Patriot Web, navigate to the Account Detail for Term page in the Student Accounts section. Account Detail for Term provides semester charges, payments, and approved but pending future payments, such as Financial Aid or Third-Party memos. The Bill and Payment System displays the current balance of the account and also allows users to make credit card or electronic check payments.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When is tuition payment due?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please visit https://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/calendars/ for the most up to date payment deadline information. Please note that classes are not dropped due to non-payment but unpaid balances are subject to late fees and holds preventing future services such as registration.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
One of my parents lives in Virginia, but the other does not. Can I qualify for in-state tuition?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Maybe. The domicile of a dependent student may be either the domicile of the parent with whom they reside, the parent who claims the student as a dependent for federal or Virginia income tax purposes, or the parent who provides the student substantial financial support. If you submit an appeal, you should provide the information for the parent that resides in Virginia.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I’m currently classified as in-state. Can my classification change to out-of-state?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes. Changes in your domicile, immigration status, or your parents domicile (if you are a dependent student) can result in a change in your classification.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

Will I receive a bill for my classes?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes, electronic bills are generated approximately one month prior to the start of each semester. Reminder bills are not mailed for additional charges or schedule adjustments. Electronic bills are available for review in the Bill+Payment System. When these bills are created, an email is sent to the student’s Mason email account and to any authorized users who are set up in the payment system. Failure to receive a reminder bill confirming your charges does not waive the requirement to make the payment prior to the due date.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I make a payment?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students are encouraged to make payment online through our Bill & Payment System. A Bill and Payment System Guide is available at: https://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/wp-content/uploads/PaymentInstruction.pdf.

For those not able to make payment online, please visit https://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/payment-information/ for additional payment method options. Please note that The Cashier’s Office is no longer accepting cash payments.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is a check made payable to GMU instead of George Mason University acceptable?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes. Please make sure that the student’s ID number (G#) is included on the check or in correspondence with the check.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I owe a balance to the university and have a hold on my account. I was just approved for a loan to cover my balance but the funds will not arrive for a few days. Can my hold be lifted in anticipation of my loan coming in?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. Unfortunately, the Student Accounts Office cannot lift your hold until your balance is paid in full.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
My parent(s) overpaid my bill using their credit card. Can I request that the credit on my account be issued to me as a refund?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. If the last method of payment was via credit card, any refund due, once requested with a Refund Request form, will be issued back to the credit card that was used for payment.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I pay my bill using funds from my 529 College Savings Plan?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students should contact their 529 plan to find out what is required in order to initiate payment to Mason. Requirements may differ depending on your plan. 

Rosters and financial guarantees should be submitted to the Third Party Billing Office using the online Portal at https://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/third-party-billing-office/. 

Students who wish to cancel a pending payment from their 529 plan should contact their plan and make this request. The 529 plan will then notify the Third Party Billing Office who will then remove the pending 529 memo or credit on the student’s account.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I tried to pay my bill with a credit card and I received this warning:  'A system error occurred, please try again later'.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Please ensure that your credit card payments do not exceed your transaction limit. If you receive the warning 'A system error occurred, please try again later' message, do NOT reattempt the transaction until you contact your financial institution.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is the $60 MATH-008 fee covered under the Senior Citizen Waiver Program?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. This fee is not covered under the Senior Citizen Waiver Program and students are responsible for paying this fee.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where will my refund check be mailed?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Refund checks are made payable to the student, with the exception of Parent PLUS Loans, and are mailed to the permanent address listed in the student's record. Please make sure that your address on file with Mason is current. If you wish to have your refund sent to an address other than your permanent address, enter the address as a “REFUND RECIPIENT” address in the Personal Information section of Patriot Web, https://patriotweb.gmu.edu. 

In-person check pick up is not available due to negotiable item security and the large number of checks processed.

NOTE: Checks are not mailed to Campus Residence (CR) addresses.

Direct Deposit is available, and is the preferred refund delivery method, which expedites refunds and avoids lost or misdirected mailed checks. To sign up for direct deposit of refunds, visit https://studentaccounts.gmu.edu/forms/ and complete a Direct Deposit Authorization form.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I purchase Tuition Insurance?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Mason has partnered with GradGuard™ to make the Tuition Insurance Plan available to our families. Please visit the Tuition Insurance page for more information.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I have questions about making a payment using Flywire.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Steps for making a payment and additional Flywire FAQs can be found at https://help.flywire.com/hc/en-us.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What happens if my paying agency does not submit payment?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If your agency does not cover the balance of your tuition charges after two (2) invoices have been sent, you will be responsible for payment. Unpaid balances are subject to late fees and holds.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where do I submit my Third Party Payment Authorization?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Students must provide a third party authorization or government training voucher to the Third Party Billing Office before the payment due date (for payment schedule by semester, please see Calendars) and pay any remaining balance that the authorization may not cover. Otherwise, a late payment fee of up to $125 may be assessed.
 

Students and agencies are required to submit the financial guarantee/authorization documentation through a portal for processing. The student link is below: 
 

Financial Guarantee/Authorizations Student Portal
 

Note: If you are using a Mason computer and having trouble accessing the link, please try clearing your cache or try a different browser.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is Third Party Billing?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The Third Party Billing Office invoices military departments, international embassies, public/private sector organizations, and educational institutions for tuition charges and associated fees for Mason students.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I was previously considered in-state at Mason, why am I now considered out of state?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Mason and the Commonwealth of Virginia require a new application for in-state tuition with each application to the university. Please complete the application for in-state tuition to be reconsidered for in-state status.

For information on in-state tuition and eligibility requirements, please visit the State Council of Higher Education for Virginia website: http://www.schev.edu/index/tuition-aid/in-state-residency.

Please keep in mind that we are not able to advise you on how to receive in-state tuition and that meeting the eligibility requirements does not guarantee that you will be given in-state tuition.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the process for submitting a Late Schedule Adjustment form?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The Late Schedule Adjustment form must be sent to the Office of the University Registrar at regsite@gmu.edu by the final approver (Department Chair / Course Dean). 

As part of the approval process, you (the student) will need to sign that you acknowledge responsibility for any additional charges the changes may cause. It will be your responsibility to ensure that all charges are paid by checking your account on Patriot Web after the class registration is complete. If additional fees are due, it is the student’s responsibility to make the payment or incur additional penalties.

Note:
Forms must be submitted to the Registrar’s Office directly from the Department. Forms submitted by the student will not be accepted. 
Please ensure that the correct version of the form is being submitted, which contains the Financial Responsibility Agreement.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the due date for Third Party billing?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The due date for accepting Third-Party Billing authorizations for each semester are posted on the Payment Calendars page. However, your tuition and fee payment due date is based on your registration date. To avoid being charged late payment penalties, payment arrangements must be completed by your tuition payment due date.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I know that Third Party billing has processed my financial guarantee?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
When your financial guarantee is processed, the deferred payment amount will appear as a memo credit on the Account Detail for Term page in the Student Accounts section of Patriot Web. If the full balance is being covered by the sponsoring agency, no balance due will show in the lower right hand column of the webpage.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can funds be transferred from my student account to the bookstore?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Credit balances are not transferrable to the bookstore. Students can use any refunds they may receive from Financial Aid or overpayments to pay for books. Refunds are sent in the form of a check or direct deposit, but due to the time if takes to process the refunds, they are often not received by students until several weeks into the semester.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I have questions about my deposit(s).
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Undergraduate deposits are the financial commitment to attend Mason and, if applicable, to reside in University housing. 

If you have questions about your enrollment deposit, please contact the Office of Admissions at admissions@gmu.edu. For housing deposit inquires, please visit the housing website at https://housing.gmu.edu/ or email housing at housing@gmu.edu.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can I use my Financial Aid to pay for Mason Payment Plan?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
When calculating your Mason Payment Plan amount, your financial aid award is only factored in when you are determining your balance due to GMU. It may not be used as the down payment.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I transferred from another Virginia school, where I was in-state. Why am I classified as out-of-state at Mason?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
There are many reasons that the Office of Admissions may have made an out-of-state determination. If you believe that you should be classified as an in-state student and have not submitted your intent to enroll, please contact the Office of Admissions to discuss your domicile determination. 

If you have submitted your intent to enroll and believe that you should be classified as an in-state student, you can submit a Domicile Appeal through the Office of the Registrar.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is there a special tuition rate for students living in Maryland and Washington DC?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No, although some departments can choose to provide discounts to certain out-of-state students. If you would like to know if your program offers a discount, contact your academic department directly. Washington DC does have a program called the District of Columbia Tuition Assistance Grant Program (DC TAG), however Mason is unable to provide information regarding eligibility for the program.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Who is considered an independent student for domicile determination?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
You are an independent student if your parents have surrendered the right to your care, custody, and earnings, do not claim you as a dependent on their federal or state income tax returns, and have ceased to provide you with substantial financial support.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I’m an F-1 student. Can I qualify for in-state tuition?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No. F-1 students are not eligible to establish domicile unless they also have an approved eligible status. For more information regarding what status’ are eligible and which are not see SCHEV's Addendum A – Descriptions and Domicile Eligibility Status for Various Categories of Aliens.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
How do I pay my bill using my credit card?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Payments using VISA, MasterCard, American Express and Discover Card can be made using the Bill+Payment System. There is a 2.85 percent convenience fee for credit card payments and this fee is nonrefundable.

Please note that Bill+Payment System is unavailable daily from 10:30 PM to 12:00 AM and Sundays from 7:00 AM to 11:15 AM (U.S. Eastern Time Zone) for maintenance.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I want to pay my bill in person, where should I go?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The Cashier’s Office is closed for in-person services. Students are encouraged to make payment online through the Bill & Payment System.

Options for those who are not able to make payment online can be found at https://cashiersoffice.gmu.edu/.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Can the Student Accounts Office release library and/or parking holds?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No, only the library and/or parking services can release their holds. The Student Accounts Office can only release student account holds.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I filed a domicile appeal and my tuition is due – do I have to pay my bill?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Yes. Filing a domicile appeal does not remove your obligation to pay your tuition and meeting all payment deadlines.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I'm a military dependent. Do I qualify for in-state tuition?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
To determine if you qualify, you must submit an appeal. Instructions and the form can be found on the Domicile Appeals website. If you have questions regarding other veteran benefits or the veteran certification process, contact the Office of Military Services at military@gmu.edu.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I'm a veteran. Do I qualify for in-state tuition?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
To determine if you qualify, you must submit an appeal. Instructions and the form can be found on the Domicile Appeals website. If you have questions regarding other veteran benefits or the veteran certification process, contact the Office of Military Services at military@gmu.edu.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I'm a active duty service member. Do I qualify for in-state tuition?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
To determine if you qualify, you must submit an appeal. Instructions and the form can be found on the Domicile Appeals website. If you have questions regarding other veteran benefits or the veteran certification process, contact the Office of Military Services at military@gmu.edu.

tags: In State and Out of State Tuition Questions
knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Who is considered a dependent student?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A student is a dependent if they are listed as a dependent on their parent(s), or legal guardians tax returns, or they receive substantial financial support (more than 50%) from them. A married student whose spouse provides substantial financial support also can be a dependent student. A student under the age of 24 on the first day of the semester or term is presumed to dependent unless the student meets one of the exceptions listed in the Virginia Code.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Will I receive a tuition refund if I withdraw from a course?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No, if you withdraw from a course you will not receive a refund. Please review the academic calendar for important dates and deadlines for tuition liability and refunds.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
If I have a financial hold on my record, can I still register for classes?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
No, you will not be able to add classes, drop classes, or order an official transcript if you have an active financial hold on your record. Please contact the Office of Student Financial Aid or the Student Accounts Office to make arrangements for payment.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
When will the Third Party Billing Office invoice my paying agency?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
The Third Party Billing Office will invoice your agency after the add/drop date has passed for the semester.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

When is the 2024-2025 VASA application available?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

The 2024-25 VASA application opened on January 22, 2024 and is available at www.VASAapp.org.

 

Mason's VASA priority filing deadline for the 2024-25 aid year is March 1, 2024.

 

Additional information and VASA FAQs can be found at www.VASAapp.org.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

What types of financial aid are available for international students?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Financial aid options for international students include:

 

Private Loans: Students who are not eligible for federal aid, or students who want to compare interest rates, can look into Private Loans. Keep in mind that most of these lenders require a US co-signer.
Prodigy Finance: Prodigy Finance is a private loan lender option for International, DACA, and undocumented students. This loan does not require a U.S. co-signer however, interest rates are higher without a U.S. cosigner.
MPower Financing: MPower Financing is a private loan lender option for International, DACA, and undocumented students as it does not require a U.S. co-signer. Eligibility criteria includes students being within two years of graduation. 
Mason Scholarship: Consider completing the Mason Scholarship Application for the upcoming academic year. Applications usually open every February for the next academic year.
Outside Scholarships: It is recommended that you apply for twenty scholarships for every one that you hear back from. This is mainly because they are very competitive. We also suggest applying for outside scholarships in November/December for the next academic year.
Mason Schools/Colleges/Units: Some of Mason’s schools and colleges administer separate funds for their respective enrolled students which may have different criteria for funding consideration. Check with your school or college to find out about their scholarship process.

Additional information can be found here.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

What is the MVPGRT (Mason Virginia Promise Grant)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

This is a Mason need-based grant currently awarded to Virginia undergraduate students who are either:

part of the Mason NOVA Advance program
designated as Early Identification Program (EIP) students and have now matriculated to Mason
dependents of a current Mason employee

 

The award is based on family income and the FAFSA calculated EFC (Expected Family Contribution).

 

To qualify, a student must:

Be an undergraduate student and resident of Virginia
Be eligible for Virginia state grants and federal aid
Report on their FAFSA form a family income of $60,000 or less, OR be Pell-eligible, AND an EFC (Expected Family Contribution) of less  than $25,000 (starting in the 2023-24 academic year).
Have filed the FAFSA or VASA by March 1 preceding the fall semester of the next year (e.g. March 1, 2023 for the 2023-24 academic year that begins in the fall).
Be enrolled full-time at the end of the drop (freeze) period (which occurs around three weeks into the semester)

 

The grant will not disburse to Student Accounts until the end of the Drop period (freeze date) each semester, once full-time enrollment for the semester is confirmed. If students are less than full-time at freeze, the award will be cancelled.

 

For those applying as a dependent of a Mason employee, the student must be a tax dependent of the Mason benefits- eligible employee. Mason employees can learn more about this benefit on the Human Resources site.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Are students under VAWA eligible for financial aid? (Battered Immigrants-Qualified Aliens)
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students may, with their designated children, be eligible for Federal Student Aid under the Violence Against Women Act (VAWA). The student must obtain and provide documentation based on their case type: self-petition, suspension of deportation, or cancellation of removal.

Documentation may be submitted in Patriot Forms. When uploading your documents in Patriot Forms, be sure to provide the front and back of your document.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Student is unable to upload financial aid verification documents to Patriot Forms using a mobile device.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students may experience an issue when using a mobile device if their browser is not supported by Patriot Forms. This may occur if the student is using the internet browser that comes pre-installed on their phone. Students should check that they are using the the latest version of compatible browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari or Internet Explorer.   
Additionally, a student may receive an error message or longer loading times when using mobile data instead of wi-fi connections. The student should try to upload when they are connected to wi-fi.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Where do I apply for the Stay Mason Student Support Fund?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Please visit https://staymason.gmu.edu for eligibility requirements and the funding application. Please review the application dates/deadlines carefully. You may email smfund@gmu.edu with any questions.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What does "Dir Ln Return to Lender" on my student account mean?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
This indicates that all or a portion of your Direct Loan has been cancelled and returned to your lender. Reasons for this adjustment may be due to:
 
receipt of additional aid (or third party resource) which caused an over award (your financial aid total exceeds your cost of attendance)
a reduction in your cost of attendance due to dropping courses
a full withdrawal which required the financial aid office to recalculate your financial aid eligibility
For questions or additional details, please reach out to the Financial Aid Office.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is an R2T4 (Return to Title IV)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

The Office of Student Financial Aid is required by federal law to re-calculate federal financial aid eligibility for students who completely withdraw from all classes, stop attending, are dismissed, never attend, or take a leave of absence prior to completing 60% of a payment period or term. According to the regulations, the amount of Federal Title IV awarded to a student must be recalculated in these situations and any portion of the financial aid received that is considered to be “unearned” must be returned to the Title IV Program(s) from which it was received. Students will be billed by Mason for any amount due to the University as a result of Title IV funds that were returned that would have been used to cover University charges.


Please note that Mason uses the same return policy for state grants as is required for federal funds.
 

If you are considering dropping or withdrawing from all your courses, please contact your Financial Aid Counselor immediately regarding possible adjustments to your financial aid.

Additional information may be found on the Office of Student Financial Aid website .

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP)?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Students must maintain Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) in order to remain eligible for financial aid. Academic progress of financial aid recipients is reviewed annually. For the majority of students, this occurs at the conclusion of spring semester. Students in the fully on-line graduate programs taught in 8 week modules will have their progress reviewed at the end of FALL semester. After the review, students who do not meet minimum SAP requirements will be ineligible for financial aid and placed on financial aid suspension. 

Academic progress is measured in three ways:
 
Quantitative Standard (Completion Rate). This standard requires all students to complete at least 67% of the credits they have attempted. This is calculated by dividing the number of completed credits by the number of attempted credits.  Attempted credits include both those earned at Mason and those transferred into Mason.  For instance, if a student has attempted 70 credits and completed 62, the student is passing the quantitative standard (62/70 = 88.6%). If a student attempted 15 credits and passed only 6, the student has failed the quantitative standard (6/15 = 40%).
 
Time Frame – All students must complete their program of study by attempting no more than 150% of the hours normally required for completion. For instance, if an undergraduate is expected to complete the degree requiring 120 credits, the student can attempt no more than 180 credits before they fail SAP for Time Frame. Please note, transfer credits brought into Mason count as attempted credits.
 
Qualitative Standard - All students must meet minimum GPA standards, depending on their level (Undergraduate, Graduate, Law)
       a. Starting with Fall 2022, undergraduate students must maintain a cumulative GPA of at least 2.0
       b. Graduate and doctoral students must maintain a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0
       c. Law students must maintain a cumulative GPA of at least 2.15

Please visit the Financial Aid website for additional SAP information, including SAP Appeal based on mitigating circumstances.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Is my Certificate Program eligible for financial aid?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
A list of Mason Certificate Programs that are eligible for federal aid can be found at: https://www.gmu.edu/financial-aid/eligibility/eligible-certificate-programs .

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I need to upload my financial aid verification documents. What link do I use to access Patriot Forms?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
To create or log in to your Patriot Forms account, visit gmu.studentforms.com .

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
I do not see financial aid on my student account.
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Reasons that your aid may not be reflected on your student account include: 
You did not accept your financial aid in PatriotWeb
You did not complete Loan Entrance Counseling and/or Master Promissory Note (MPN) as required at studentaid.gov 
You are not enrolled in the minimum credits required for your aid awards (i.e. half-time for federal loans) 
You have not submitted financial aid verification documents in Patriot Forms and therefore have not been offered financial aid
You are not meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP). and therefore have not been offered financial aid

Please visit financialaid.gmu.edu for additional information and eligibility requirements.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
Should I complete a FAFSA or a VASA?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
Not sure which application to file? Take the VASA Questionnaire.

If you are a United States Citizen or an Eligible Noncitizen (see below), you should only file a federal FAFSA for consideration of both federal and Virginia financial aid each academic year.  

Eligible Noncitizens: (complete a FAFSA)

An eligible noncitizen is a U.S. national (includes natives of American Samoa or Swains Island), U.S. permanent resident (who has an I-151, I-551 or I-551C [Permanent Resident Card]), or an individual who has an Arrival-Departure Record (I-94) from U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) showing one of the following designations:
 
"Refugee"
"Asylum Granted"
"Cuban-Haitian Entrant (Status Pending)"
"Conditional Entrant" (valid only if issued before April 1, 1980)
Victims of human trafficking, T-visa (T-2, T-3, or T-4, etc.) holder
"Parolee" (You must be paroled into the United States for at least one year and you must be able to provide evidence from the USCIS that you are in the United States for other than a temporary purpose and that you intend to become a U.S. citizen or permanent resident.)

If you are NOT a United States Citizen or an Eligible Noncitizen as noted above, you should submit a VASA Application to see if you qualify to receive state financial aid.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What is the VASA?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
What is the VASA?
The Virginia Alternative State Aid (VASA) Application is an alternative option for students who are ineligible to file a FAFSA. The VASA is designed to calculate students’ Expected Family Contribution (EFC) which is then used to determine eligibility for undergraduate state need-based financial assistance. This state financial aid application is a free and safe way for students to pursue financial assistance for postsecondary education.

Who should file a VASA Application?
Virginians who are nonimmigrants, undocumented, have Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) status or are otherwise ineligible to file the FAFSA and want to be considered for state financial aid. The VASA application should only be completed by Virginia residents who are ineligible for FAFSA funding.

What types of need-based state funds are eligible students considered for?
Need-based Virginia state funding includes the Commonwealth Award, Virginia Guaranteed Assistance Program and more. 

How to apply
The VASA application and additional eligibility information is available at www.VASAapp.org

**Mason's 2022-23 priority deadline for VASA submission is May 1, 2022.**

https://www.gmu.edu/financial-aid/virginia-alternative-state-aid-application-vasa

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
If the student chooses that they and/or their parents will use the IRS Data Retrieval Tool (DRT) to transfer their federal tax return information to their FAFSA, how do they submit their task?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If the student chooses an option that indicates that the student and/or their parents will log back into the FAFSA and use the IRS DRT, they are presented with a ‘log into FAFSA’ step. The student is not able to progress past the ‘log into FAFSA’ step until they or their parents successfully use the IRS DRT tool.  

The student can select the ‘Log Into FAFSA’ link to get directed to the FAFSA.  If the student and/or parent successfully imports their IRS tax information into their FAFSA, once the subsequent FAFSA is loaded into the system the step will be removed and the student can submit their form.

If the student and/or parent is unable to use the IRS DRT the student must go back into the household form and choose a different option on how they will provide their IRS transcripts to the school. Once they correct and sign their household form, the ‘log into FAFSA’ step will be replaced by the appropriate document upload steps.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

In Patriot Forms, why do both the student and parent have to sign in the same manner?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Both of the signatures on a document must be applied in the same manner (i.e. either both must e-sign or both must wet sign). This helps prevent unauthorized changes to a document without both signers’ consent.

Patriot Forms is unable to seal the document to ensure its validity unless both the student and parent sign in the same manner.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

The parent is entering the correct information in Patriot Forms (Financial Aid Verification). Why are they unable to create an account?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If the parent is entering their information and they are unable to create an account, the student/parent should confirm the following:

1) Is the parent entering the information exactly as it appears on the FAFSA?
Check the First Initial and Last Name on the FAFSA for extra spaces, special characters, or suffixes
If the FAFSA contains any of these in the last name, they must be entered exactly the same in the create account screen
2)  Does the SSN entered for the parent match the information provided on the FAFSA?
The SSN should be entered without dashes(hyphens) or spaces
If the parent is copying and pasting the SSN into the field and is unable to create an account, they may want to type the SSN into the field
(Typing in the SSN instead of copying/pasting helps to avoid copying extra spaces or dashes that should not be entered in the SSN field)
2) Has the student sent the e-sign request to the parent?
If the student has requested the e-signature from the parent, the e-sign request step in the student's Patriot Forms account will show text to indicate that the e-signature has been requested.
If the student has not requested the e-signature, the step will indicate that the signature request has not been initiated. 
3) Only the parent that the student selects on the e-signature request screen will be able to create an account.
If the parent not selected in the request screen tries to create an account using their information, they will receive an error.
If they need to send the signature request to the other parent listed they may do so in the edit request button.
The parent can only access the Create Parent Account page from the link that is sent through the request from the student. If the parents both have the same first initial and last name, the student may need to edit the request and send it to the other parent listed.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

I haven't been able to find an internship. How else can I gain experience?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

There are many ways to gain experience beyond an internship, including volunteering, research, a job, leadership in a student organization and studying abroad. Check out the Gain Experiences section for the careers that interest you at: Career Specific Resources | University Career Services (gmu.edu) or schedule an appointment to discuss your search strategy: Make an Appointment | University Career Services (gmu.edu).

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

What is a Career Fair?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

A career fair is an event that connects employers with job/internship seekers.  Attending a career fair provides the opportunity to learn about different career options, establish professional relationships, and discuss jobs and/or internships available within specific organizations. Mason holds several career fairs throughout the academic year.  Check out the events calendar at: https://careers.gmu.edu/events

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

What is Handshake?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Handshake is Mason’s platform for on-campus, part-time, work-study, internship, and full-time jobs. Handshake can also be used to get career advice from peers, alumni and employers, view a list of upcoming career events and schedule appointments with University Career Services.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

Who can help me find a part-time job on campus?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Handshake is Mason’s job/internship database for students.  Additional resources for finding a job or internship can be found at: Find a Job or Internship or for personalized assistance, make an appointment: Make an Appointment with Career Srvs.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

I can't afford an unpaid internship. What should I do?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Nearly 90% of the internships listed in Handshake are paid.  However, if you are unable to find a paid internship in your field, you can apply to the Scholarship for Unpaid Internships through University Carer Services, inquire about departmental funding and meet with your Financial Aid Counselor to discuss other scholarship options.  Additionally, you can ask employers with unpaid internships if they can offer a travel and/or meal stipend to help offset the cost to you to do the internship.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

Where should I look for internships?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

Top sources of internships include Handshake (internship platform for Mason students), career fairs, and your faculty/academic advisors.

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION

I applied to several jobs/internships and haven't heard back.  What should I do?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER

It is appropriate to follow-up with employers to express your continued interest and check in on the status of your application 2-4 weeks after the application deadline. If you haven’t already had your resume/cover letter reviewed to ensure you are marketing your qualifications effectively, schedule an appointment:  Make an Appointment | University Career Services (gmu.edu)

knowledge-base.question:
QUESTION
What can I do if I missed the graduation application deadline?
knowledge-base.answer:
ANSWER
If you need to apply for graduation and the application is no longer available in Patriot Web, you can submit a Late Graduation Application Form, found at https://registrar.gmu.edu/forms/. Please complete your portion of the form and send to your academic department to obtain the necessary signatures. Your department will then route the form to the Registrar's office for processing. Please note that if the six-week graduation grace period has passed, Late Graduation Applications will not be accepted and instead you will need to submit a Retroactive Graduation Application.
